Solteira e mãe de 1 filho que frequenta a Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta 2 irmãos enviando dinheiro para ajudar a pagar as propinas Escolares e alimentação.
Tem um negócio próprio de venda de produtos diversos, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (cervejas, arroz, óleo, açúcar, sabão, e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.
No futuro pretende construir uma mercearia com capacidade de armazenar grande quantidade de produtos, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é adquirir uma viatura que possa ajudar no transporte de produtos para o seu estabelecimento.
texts.en:
Dulce is the single mother of 1 son who attends School, lives in her own house with her family and supports 2 brothers by sending them money to help pay for their Education and food.

She has her own business selling various products and with this loan she plans to buy goods (beer, rice, oil, sugar, soap and others) to increase the quantity of her stock.

In future, Dulce intends to build a grocery store with the capacity to store large quantities of products and to this end, she commits to duly paying off her loan so that she can solicit further loans from Hluvuku. 

Her challenge is to purchase a vehicle that can help with transporting products to her establishment.

loans.use: buy goods (beer, rice, oil, sugar, soap and others) to increase the quantity of her stock.

loans.name: Kheng

texts.en:
Kheng is 43 years old. She is married and was blessed with four children, one of whom is married. She is a hard-working farmer who is involved in the rice farming business while her husband devotes himself to providing construction services. She has learned to manage from her parents and has been doing it for almost 17 years. She and her husband aim to stabilize their income so that they will be able to provide basic necessities and educate their children. Currently, they live in a small village of Prey district, Kompong Cham province

Due to insufficient funds, Kheng is asking for a loan in the amount of USD 450 in order to buy construction supplies to support her husband's business. She believes that this loan will enable her husband to work out his plans and hopes that he will be able to generate a good income by providing his construction services.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to support her husband's business.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is fifty years old and married with four children. She generates her income from the tailoring services she provides to her customers. She has previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya.

Since she has become a client of Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to save money, because she has been trained in financial management. She hopes to expand her business in future. She needs a loan of 50,000 KES to buy 15 rolls of materials.

loans.use: To buy 15 rolls of materials

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is 37 years old and married and with two children aged 6 and 8 years. He runs a cereal shop. Besides that, he owns a pick-up, which he uses for his transport business.

Since he has become a client of Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to manage his business, because he has been trained in business management skills. He has actually managed to grow his business and employ two people. He hopes to open more stores in different locations in the future. He needs a loan of 100,000 KES to buy maize, beans, and green grams.

loans.use: To buy maize, beans, and green grams

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 28 años, es una mujer humilde, optimista y muy trabajadora. Tiene una relación con David, de 31 años, con quien tiene una hija de 6 años llamada Milena, por quien se esfuerza y se sacrifica día a día trabajando arduamente para poder brindarle una mejor calidad de vida. Actualmente viven en su casa propia, la que han logrado conseguir con esfuerzo y dedicación, ahí comparten sus días felices y tristes como una familia unida.

Ella se dedica a la venta de repuestos, piezas y accesorios para todo tipo de vehículos, pero básicamente para motocarros. Asimismo, realiza el mantenimiento y reparaciones de éstos; y gracias a la excelente calidad de su trabajo es considerada como una de las mejores en este rubro y se ha convertido en una de las más conocidas de la ciudad, fama que comparte con su esposo, quien trabaja junto a ella desde que se inició el negocio, hace un año y 6 meses. Tienen muchos clientes, esto le genera seguridad y estabilidad económica. Este trabajo lo realiza en un local que alquilaron, aunque al principio fue un poco difícil por el temor y las dudas que sentían, pero no se dejaron amilanar y hoy por hoy siguen adelante con el deseo de seguir creciendo. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es ver que sus clientes se sienten contentos cuando observan que sus motocarros terminan en buenas condiciones y funcionando a la perfección, satisfacción que ella conoce y comparte de cerca ya que también tiene dos motocarros que alquila para transporte de pasajeros. Es por ello que su meta es conseguir un local más grande, en el que pueda brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes y donde pueda contar con una mayor cantidad de repuestos de distintas marcas, ya sea para ofrecerlos en venta como también con los que pueda continuar su trabajo de reparación.

Este es su crédito número 5 con MFP, por tanto agradece la oportunidad y confianza que ponen en ella para recibir este crédito. Por otro lado, se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual. Y además le agrada ser parte del banco comunal al que pertenece, ya que ha visto que sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias.

Con el monto solicitado (S/.2000) incrementará su stock de repuestos, piezas, accesorios y herramientas en su taller. Entre ellos: cámaras, rodajes, llantas, pernos, aceites, etc. Por otra parte, también refaccionará uno de sus motocarros, comprando un motor nuevo, cambiará el tapiz, pagara el seguro obligatorio y actualizará la documentación de circulación.
texts.en:
Carmen is 28 years old.  She is a modest, optimistic and very hard-working woman.  She has a 6-year-old daughter called Milena and she works hard every day in order to provide her with a better quality of life.  The family currently live in their own home which they acquired through a lot of hard work and commitment.  There they share their happy days and sad days, as a united family.

Carmen's business is selling spare parts and accessories for all kinds of vehicles but mainly motorcycle taxis.  She also services and repairs these vehicles.  Thanks to the excellent quality of her work, she is considered one of the best in her field and has become one of the best-known mechanics in the city, an honor she shares with her husband who has been working alongside her since she opened the business 18 months ago.  The couple have a lot of customers which provides them with security and financial stability.  They carry out their work in premises that they rent.  At first things were a little difficult owing to the fear and doubts that they had but they remained undaunted and now they continue wanting to grow their business.  What Carmen most enjoys about her work is seeing that her customers are happy when they find their cars in good condition and working well.  She is familiar with this feeling of satisfaction because she has two motorcycle taxis of her own which she hires out for transporting passengers.  Her goal is to acquire larger premises so that she can provide her customers with a better service and to have a larger quantity of different brands of spare parts both to sell and to use in her repair work.

This is Carmen's fifth loan from MFP and she is grateful for the opportunity and the trust that is being placed in her with this loan.  She pledges to make her repayments on time.  She enjoys being a member of her community bank because she has seen that her fellow members are responsible and supportive people.

Carmen will use the sum of 2,000 soles that she has requested to increase her stock of spare parts, accessories and tools for her workshop.  These include inner tubes, wheels, tires, bolts, oils, etc.  She will also refurbish one of her motorcycle taxis, buying a new engine, replacing the upholstery, paying the obligatory insurance and updating the vehicle's papers.

loans.use: to increase her stock of spare parts, accessories and tools for her workshop

loans.name: Virgen Del Rosario Group

texts.es:
Este grupo llamado Virgen del Rosario es de ciudad del Este y cuenta con 15 integrantes, donde todas ellas trabajan con gran entusiasmo y dedicación. Gracias a su trabajo ya están en el noveno ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación Paraguaya.
 Alicia es la presidenta del grupo, ella se dedica a la peluquería, y cuenta que tiene un negocio muy bien mantenido, donde  atiende a sus clientes. Gracias al buen trato que les da, ya tiene clientela fiel que siempre acude a ella. Alicia nos comenta que sueña con poder ampliar su local y de esa forma poder tener mayores ingresos para ayudar a su familia,  y también quiere dar fuentes de trabajo a las demás personas.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de tintes, esmaltes, peines, tijeras, secador de pelo, planchitas y otros insumos para poder seguir trabajando en su negocio.
texts.en: This group, called "Virgen del Rosario," is from the city of Este and has 15 members, all of whom work with great enthusiasm and dedication. Thanks to their hard work they are already in their ninth loan cycle in the program for enterprising women with the Fundación Paraguaya. Alicia is the president of the group, and she works in hair styling. She tells us that she has a very well maintained business where she waits on her customers. Thanks to the good treatment she gives them, she has loyal customers who always come back for her. Alicia tells us that she dreams of being able to expand her shop, and in this way have greater income in order to help her family. She also wants to provide a source of work for other people. She is asking for the loan to buy dyes, nail enamel, combs, scissors, a hair dryer, straightening irons and other supplies to be able to continue working on her business.

loans.use: to buy dyes, nail enamel, combs, scissors, a hair dryer, straightening irons, and other supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase large quantities of bananas to sell

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok, age 31, works for a garment factory in a suburb of Phnom Penh city. Sewing clothes is the main part of her family’s income. Sok is married to a humble man who works with a construction team to provide construction services around the country. She has three school-age children who completely depend on her care. Sok told us that she still has financial difficulties because the income generated from their businesses seems barely enough to cover the high cost of commodities. However, Sok has tried hard in her career, working overtime to get extra profit to support the family.

In order to reduce some of the family's transportation expenses, Sok would like to take out a loan of USD 500 to purchase a second-hand motorcycle for the household use as well as for support of her business. She and her husband can travel to work by themselves without taking other taxi services. She believes that she will be able to better her living standard someday as she strives to work harder.

loans.use: to purchase a second-hand motorcycle.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 2 filhos dos quais 1 frequenta a Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Trabalha como professora e quadro do Ministério da Educação, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material (25 sacos de cimento, e 30 chapas de zinco) para dar continuidade a obra da sua casa.
No futuro pretende fazer um negocio de criação de pintos para aumentar a renda mensal, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é a falta de fundos de investimento para construir a capoeira.
texts.en:
Olivia is married and the mother of 2 children, 1 of whom attends School. She lives in her own house and doesn't support anyone else.

She works as a tenured teacher with the Ministry of Education and with this loan she plans to buy materials (25 sacks of cement and 30 sheets of zinc) to continue building her house.

In future, Olivia intends to have a chick rearing business to increase her monthly income and to this end, she commits to duly paying off her loan so that she can solicit further loans from Hluvuku. 

Her challenge is the lack of funds to invest in building a hencoop.

loans.use: buy materials (25 sacks of cement and 30 sheets of zinc) to continue building her house.

loans.name: Pc1 Mbourokh Mbour Group

texts.fr:
Ce banc villageois a été crée depuis le 24/04/2010. Il regroupe des femmes issus du même village et des 

villages environnants.

Elles sont unies par des liens sociaux et s'activent dans leur majorité dans le petit commerce.

Madame Boulel est une femme mariée âgée de 45 ans et mère de 5 enfants dont 4 garçons et 1 fille. Elle est 

debout à gauche de la photo.

Madame  fait du commerce de tissus teintés depuis une bonne durée et dispose d'une bonne expérience dans ce 

domaine.

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra de se procurer des tissus qu'elle va revendre au détail à ses amis au niveau 

du quartier.

Les bénéfices lui permettent de payer du ciment pour la réfection de sa maison et des habits pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
This Banc Villageois was set up on 24th April 2010 and is made up of women from the same village and surrounding villages. Their social links brought them together and the majority of them have small trading activities.

Boulel is a married women who is 45 years old and mother to five children: four boys and one girl. She is standing on the left of the photo. She has been trading in dyed fabrics for a long time and has good experience in this field. Her new loan will enable her to get fabrics that she will resell on a retail basis to her friends in the neigborhood. The profits she makes will allow her to pay for cement for restoring her house and for clothes for her children.

loans.use: to buy dyed fabrics

loans.name: Mujeres Al Poder Group

texts.es:
El comité “MUJER AL PODER” se encuentra en el tercer ciclo del programa de Mujeres de la Fundación Paraguaya, tiene  22 integrantes y todas ellas ya realizan actividades productivas, también hacen actividades para ayudarse las unas a las otras y también a su familia.
Blanca es la presidenta del grupo, y comenta que siempre se esfuerza mucho por poder superarse cada día, ya que la vida esta muy pesada y quiere dar lo que su familia necesita. Ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de todo tipo, y es gracias a este trabajo que ella ha podido salir adelante y mejorar sus ingresos.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de invierno, ya que se acerca el frío y quiere poder tener una buena variedad de productos para poder atraer a los clientes.
texts.en:
The committee "Mujer al Poder" finds itself in its third loan cycle in the women's program with Fundación Paraguaya. The committee has 22 members and all of them work productively. They also do activities to help one another and their families.

Blanca is the president of the group, and she tells us that she always makes a big effort to be able to better herself every day as life is very hard and she wants to give her family what they need. She works selling all types of clothing, and thanks to this work she has been able to come out ahead and improve her income.

She is asking for a loan to buy articles of winter clothing, since the cold weather is coming and she wants to be able to have a good variety of products to be able to attract customers.

loans.use: to buy articles of winter clothing to sell.

loans.name: Eliezel

texts.en:
Eliezel is 48 years old and married with six children aged between 8 and 25 years old. He sells various goods such as lotions, soap, cooking oil, sugar, etc. He works from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily, except on the weekends. He currently employs one person to help him. He has two years of experience in this work. 

Eliezel has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy various goods such as lotions, soap, cooking oil, sugar, etc. to sell. With any profits, he will be able to save money for his future, pay school fees for his children, and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To buy various goods such as lotions, soap, cooking oil, sugar, etc. to sell

loans.name: Teresa Giovanny

texts.es:
Teresa tiene 37 años, es madre soltera, tiene una hija y vive en casa familiar. Ella vive en Tucume en una comunidad pequeña con un aproximado de 100  familias y cuenta con servicios de  luz y agua.

Ella siempre se ha dedicado a la crianza y venta de animales y bodega. Ha desarrollado gran experiencia en el negocio, vende especialmente lo que es chanchos ,patos y cerveza, vende sus animlaes por toda la zona de tucume ya cuenta con clientes fijos. 

Precisamente teresa ha podido desarrollar este negocio gracias a su trabajo fuerte y buena reputacion dado que este es su tercer prestamo con la entidad. Este ultimo prestamo de 2500 soles lo utlizara para expandir su negocio comprando animales, especialmente canchos, patos y alimentos.
texts.en:
Teresa, 37, is a single mother.  She has one daughter and lives in her family house, in a small community in Túcume with approximately 100 families, and has electricity and water services.

She always has worked raising and selling animals and groceries.  She has developed excellent experience in business.  She especially sells pigs, ducks, and beer.  She sells her animals throughout the Túcume area and already has regular customers.

In particular, Teresa has been able to develop this business thanks to her hard work and good reputation, because this is her third loan with the organization.  She will use this latest loan of 2500 soles [PEN] to expand her business buying animals, especially pigs and ducks, and animal feed.

loans.use: to buy pigs, ducks, and animal feed.

loans.name: Morn

texts.en:
Morn is from Baray district, Kompong Tom province. She is 44 years old, married, and has six single children. Two of her children decided to work as laborers in the neighboring country and to help the family with a part of their income. Morn is a farmer as well as a piggery business owner who wants to upgrade her standard of living and attain a better quality of life. She cultivates rice two times a year because three hectares of her farmland are located next to the water supplies of the province.

Morn is now asking for a loan of USD 1,000 to buy seeds, fertilizer and insecticide for growing her rice crops. She hopes that through her loan, she can provide for the basic needs of her children and save for future emergencies of the family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and insecticide for growing her rice crops.

loans.name: Mes

texts.en:
Mes is 52 years of age and a single mother with eight children. Most of her children are employed and have independent lives. Nowadays, Mes patiently runs a fish vending business from which she generates about USD 4.00 each day on average. She uses her income to meet her daily needs and to care for the family, especially her school-age kids.

Men would like to take out a loan in the amount of USD 1,500 to purchase a used motorcycle for the entire family to use. This will help her children to get to their workplaces easily without taking motor-taxi services. This will help minimize the expenses in her family as well. She hopes to obtain this loan so she can better her family’s living condition, enabling her to increase her profits and save some more for emergency purposes.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle for the entire family to use.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
YOLANTA TIENE  32  AÑOS DE EDAD, ES DE  ESTADO CIVIL SOLTERA Y VIVE EN TUCUME. SU ACTIVIDAD COMERCIAL ES LA COMPRA Y VENTA DE ANIMALES, CONTANDO CON EXPERIENCIA  DE  5 AÑOS EN LAS CUALES A DESARROLLADO UN BUEN NEGOCIO.
 
ADICIONALMENTE   SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE PRODUCTOS DE BELLEZA TENIENDO SU NEGOCIO UBICADO EN SU PROPIO DOMICILIO. AHORA CUENTA CON UNA CLIENTELA  FIJA(Comerciantes de mercados)LA CUAL HA DESARROLLADO A BASE DE ESFUERZO.
 
EL PRESTAMO SE DESTINARA PARA COMPRA  DE  ANIMALES, ALIMENTOS Y ARREGLO DEL CORRAL. ACTUALMENTE  SE HA PROPUESTO  EN INCREMENTAR SU NEGOCIO DE  ANIMALES Y PRODUCTO DE BELLEZA Y ESTOS 1500 SOLES SON CRUCIALES PARA QUE YOLANDA ALCANZE SU OBJETIVO.
texts.en:
Yolanda, 32, is single and lives in Túcume.  Her business activity is buying and selling animals.  With five years of experience she has developed a good business.  She also sells beauty products in a business located in her own home.  Currently she has a steady clientele (merchants from markets), which she has developed with effort.

She will use the loan to buy animals and feed, and to repair the corral.  Currently she has set out to increase her business selling animals and beauty products, and these 1500 soles [PEN] are crucial for Yolanda to reach her goal.

loans.use: to buy animals and feed, and to repair the corral.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 28 years old and married with one child. She operates a retail shop to earn a living. She also sells clothes to supplement her income.

Since she became a client of Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to save because she has been trained in financial management. She hopes to expand her business in the future.  She hopes to open a wholesale business in the future for more income generation. She also dreams of improving her living standards.  She needs a loan of 100,000 KES to buy maize flour, rice, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.use: To buy maize flour, rice, sugar and cooking oil

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua cooks banku (fermented and cooked corn or cassava dough) for sale at Mfuom near Abura.  She serves her banku with soup, vegetable stew, and pepper sauce and fish.  Ekua is a widow and has 3 children. She uses her income to support her children.  Her loan will be used to buy bags of maize and cassava to prepare banku. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to start a restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize and cassava for preparation of the banku she sells

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita sells and cooks Ga kenkey (fermented maize or cassava dough), which she serves with fried fish, pepper, and tomato sauce at Kajebil near Takoradi. Rita has done this for 21 years. She is married and has three children. She uses her income to assist her husband in paying their utility bills. Her loan will be used to purchase fish and bags of maize, which she uses in preparing her Ga kenkey. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize and fish which she uses in preparing her Ga kenkey for sale

loans.name: Airina

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 6 filhos 3 frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta 2 netos que vivem com ela.
Tem um negócio próprio de criação e venda de frangos, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar ração e vitaminas para administrar nos pintos que possui na sua casa.
No futuro pretende identificar mais mercado para os seus frangos e poder abastecer a mais clientes, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é poder aumentar a sua capoeira para poder aumentar o número de pintos na sua criação.
texts.en:
Airina is married and the mother of 6 children, 3 of whom attend School. She lives in her own house with her family and supports 2 grandchildren who live with her.

She has her own business raising and selling hens. With this loan she plans to buy ration and vitamins for the chicks she already owns at home.

In future, Airina intends to identify another market for her hens so that she can reach out to more clients and to this end, she commits to duly paying off her loan so that she can solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

Her challenge is to expand her hencoop to increase the number of chicks she's raising.

loans.use: buy ration and vitamins for the chicks she is raising

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena tiene 23 años, es una mujer luchadora, amable y muy trabajadora. Su pareja, hace 5 años, es William, de 28 años, con quien tiene una hija de 3 años llamada Jeslyn. Por el momento viven en la casa de suegra, lugar en el que comparten la alegría de educar y criar a su hija y encaminan todos sus esfuerzos y sacrificios para brindarle una mejor calidad de vida.

Su negocio es la venta de golosinas, frutas, bebidas y otros productos que solicitan los niños en la escuela donde trabaja. Posee un pequeño puesto al frente la escuela de la zona en la que vive y ahí se establece desde las 8.00 am hasta las 6.00 pm, al momento del ingreso, recreo y salida de los niños. En las horas de menor concurrencia de público cuida a su niña y le da todas las atenciones que necesita, propias de su corta edad. Considera que lo más difícil de su trabajo es tener que permanecer bajo el inclemente sol todo el día, lleva en esta actividad un poco más de 6 años, trabaja sola, mientras que su pareja trabaja en su motocarro. 
Le gusta su labor porque tiene libertad para realizar otras actividades, como por ejemplo estudiar, actualmente ha culminado sus estudios de Técnica en Enfermería y está en camino de obtener su titulo profesional para poder desempeñarse como enfermera. Con sus ingresos desea establecer una tienda de golosinas, en honor al trabajo con el que se inició y del cual se siente muy orgullosa por todas las satisfacciones que le ha regalado. Espera pronto lograr su meta y continuar en la ruta del éxito y la prosperidad por el bien de su familia.

Este es el crédito número 7 con MFP, por tanto agradece a quienes hacen posible su préstamo para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, está comprometida, una vez más, a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas, como lo hizo en anteriores créditos. Y está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son muy buenos, amables y solidarios.

Con el monto solicitado (S/. 2000) comprará mayor cantidad de golosinas, frutas y otros productos que consumen los niños, de esta forma espera mantener estables sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Elena is 23 years old, a determined woman, amiable and very hard-working. Her husband, for 5 years now, is William, who is 28 years old. They a 3-year-old daughter named Jeslyn. At present, they live in her mother-in-law's house, where they share the joy of raising and educating their daughter and make all their efforts and sacrifices to offer her a better quality of life.

Elena's business is selling sweets, fruit, drinks, and other products requested by children at a school. She has a small stand in front of the school in the zone where she lives, and there she works from 8:00 am until 6:00 pm, when the students enter, enjoy recess, and depart. During the hours of less public traffic, she cares for her daughter, providing all the attention appropriate to her young age. Elena considers having to remain under the hot sun all day to be the most difficult aspect of her work. She has been doing this a little over 6 years, working alone, while her husband works in his motor car.

Elena enjoys her work because it gives her the liberty to do other activities, such as, for example, studying. She has finished her studies in Nursing Technology and she is en route to obtaining her professional title in order to become a nurse. With her current income she wants to establish a sweets store, taking advantage of all her work since the beginning. She is very proud of all the satisfaction it has brought her. She hopes to reach her goal and continue on the road to success and prosperity for the good of her family.

This is Elena's 7th loan with MFP, and she is grateful to all who support this loan and make possible her continuation towards her objectives. In addition, she is committed, once again, to pay punctually, as she has with previous loans. And Elena is very content to belong to her communal bank, since all the members are very good, kind, and supportive. 

With the solicited amount (2,000 new sols), she will purchase a larger quantity of sweets, fruit, and other products consumed by the children, and in this manner, Elena hopes to maintain a stable income.

loans.use: buy more products for her snacks, fruit, and drinks stand.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para poderlo invertir en el negocio, comprandose materia prima para la elaboración de atoles, panes, pupusas, ya que a diario utilizan lo que es azúcar, maíz, condimentos, pollo, aceite, entre otros más que son parte de los ingredientes.
Ella considera que a través del préstamo anterior logró mejorar la rentabilidad del negocio, pues le dio los recursos necesarios para poder mantener la mercadería a la mano, de la cual considera que también su familia se a visto beneficiada ya que han tenido un mayor ingreso económico.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is requesting a new loan to be able to invest in the business, buying raw material for the production of hot corn drinks, breads and pupusas (stuffed tortillas), since daily they use sugar, corn, seasonings, chicken and oil among other ingredients.

She considers that through the previous loan she was able to improve the profitability of the business, as it gave her the necessary resources to be able to maintain the merchandise at hand. She considers that her family has also seen benefit since they have had higher economic profits.

loans.use: to buy sugar, corn, seasonings, chicken and oil.

loans.name: Maria

texts.pt:
Solteira e mãe de 6 filhos dos quais 4 frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Tem um negócio próprio de venda de roupas usadas, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar fardos de roupa para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.
No futuro pretende concluir a obra da sua casa e construir uma barraca no quintal da sua casa, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é apoiar os filhos a prosseguir com os Estudos para se formarem profissionalmente.
texts.en:
Maria is the single mother of 6 children, 4 of whom attend School. She lives in her own house with her family and doesn't support anyone else.

She has her own business selling used clothes and with this loan she plans to buy bundles of clothes to increase the quantity of her stock.

In future, Maria intends to finish building her house and build a stall in her backyard. To this end, she commits to duly paying off her loan so that she can solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

Her challenge is to support her children with their Studies so that they can graduate and become professionals.

loans.use: buy bundles of clothes to increase the quantity of her stock.

loans.name: Horacio

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 5 filhos todos frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Trabalha como segurança e um dos quadros da empresa Delta, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material (cimento, areia, pedra, blocos, e outros) para dar a continuidade a obra da sua casa.
No futuro pretende ampliar a sua casa e construir um murro de vedação para dar mais segurança a sua família, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é adquirir uma viatura para transportar os seus produtos.
texts.en:
Horacio is married and the father of 5 children who attend School, lives in his own house with his family and doesn't support anyone else.

He works as a security guard and is a permanent employee of Delta. With this loan he plans to purchase materials (cement, sand, stone, blocks and others) to continue building his house.

In future he intends to expand his house as well as build a wall with fencing around it to give his family more security and to this end, he commits to duly paying off his loan so that he can solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

His challenge is to buy a vehicle to transport his materials.

loans.use: purchase materials (cement, sand, stone, blocks and others) to continue building his house.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to cultivate large quantities of rice for resale

loans.name: Antie

texts.en:
Antie is into soap production. She produces and sells soap, which she has done for several years now.  Antie is divorced and has 2 children.  As a single parent, she uses her income to feed and clothe her children in addition to paying their school fees.

Antie will use her loan to purchase the raw materials she uses in her soap production. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase the raw marterials she uses in her soap production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more bananas.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 30 years old and married with one child. He does video editing and film production and has two employees. Besides that, he has a car for transportation services.

Since he became a client of Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to manage and expand his business because he has been trained on business management skills. He hopes to expand his studio in the future. He needs a loan of 100,000 KES to buy a computer for video editing.

loans.use: to buy computer for video editing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cooking utensils and charcoal for the café.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther cooks and sells Ga kenkey [fermented corn dough wrapped in corn or banana leaves] which she serves with fried fish, pepper and tomato sauce in Kajebil near Takoradi. Esther has done this for 15 years. She is married and has three children. She uses her income to pay for her children’s school fees. Her loan will be used to purchase fish and bags of maize which she uses in preparing her Ga kenkey. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize and fish which she uses to prepare her Ga kenkey for sale

loans.name: Martha Cecilia

texts.es: Martha  es  una  persona  responsable y  dedicada  a  su   familia, se acerco  a la  institución  ya  que  su mayor  sueño  es  acondicionar  su  hogar por  que  es  el patrimonio de  sus  hijos, es  por ello que  en este  momento  desea  pintar  y  enyesar  las  paredes  exteriores de su  casa ,  ve  en  el  crédito la posibilidad  de  que   su  hogar  tenga  una  excelente  imagen  por lo  que  se  encuentra  muy  contenta.
texts.en: Martha is a responsible person who is dedicated to her family. She approached the institution because her greatest dream is to refurbish her home since it is her children's inheritance. Thus she wishes at this time to paint and plaster the exterior walls of her house. Through the loan she sees the possibililty of her home looking great and so she is quite happy.

loans.use: to plaster and paint the exterior walls of her home.

loans.name: Jemima

texts.en: Jemima is a petty trader. She sells vegetables like garden eggs, peppers, tomatoes, and onions as well as cooking oil and fish at Mfuom near Abura. Jemima has been in this business for some time now and wishes to buy other food items her customers have requested. A loan from Kiva will be used to buy fish, vegetables, and other food items to satisfy her customers. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fish, vegetables, and other food items to satisfy her customers.

loans.name: Afia

texts.en: Afia extracts palm oil and kernel oil, which she sells at Mfuom near Elmina. Afia is married to a farmer and has 2 children. She uses her income to support her husband in feeding and clothing their children. Afia will use her loan to purchase more palm fruit and palm kernels to extract oil from. With the new profit, she wishes to buy a machine so she can expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more palm fruit and palm kernels to extract and sell

loans.name: Maame  Yaa

texts.en:
Maame Yaa is a baker. She bakes meat pies and pastries, which she sells at Mfuom near Abura. She has done this for many years.  

Maame Yaa is married. She uses her income to support her husband in paying their utility bills. Maame Yaa will use her loan to purchase flour, sugar, and meat. With the new profits from her expanded business she will purchase another oven to make her work easier.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, and meat to bake meat pies and pastries

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua is a petty trader. She sells cooking oil, tomatoes, onions, and other food items at Mfuom near Abura. Efua  has been in this business for some time now and she wishes to buy other food items that her customers request. She will use her loan from Kiva to buy more items for her shop. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase food items and vegetables to satisfy her customers.

loans.name: Angelo

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 3 filhos dos quais 2 frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta seus pais enviando dinheiro para auxiliar nas despesas alimentares.
Trabalha como motorista numa empresa privada, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material (aros, janelas, portas; e outros) para dar continuidade a obra da sua casa.
No futuro pretende construir casas para aluguer para aumentar a renda familiar, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é poder comprar uma viatura para fins comerciais.
texts.en:
Angelo is married and the father of 3 children, 2 of whom attend School, lives in his own house with his family supports his parents by sending them money to help with food expenses.

He works as a driver for a private company and with this loan he plans to purchase materials (frames, windows, doors and others) to continue building his house.

In future he intends to build houses to rent in order to increase his family's income and to this end, he commits to duly paying off his loan so that he can solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

His challenge is to buy a vehicle for commercial means.

loans.use: purchase materials (frames, windows, doors and others) to continue building his house.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Edgar tiene 28 años, es un joven bueno, amable y muy trabajador. Actualmente se encuentra separado de la mujer que fue su pareja durante un año, con quien tuvo una hija, la pequeña tiene un año y 2 meses. Él vive en una casa alquilada y trabaja mucho todos los días para mejorar su situación económica y poder ofrecerle a su hija una mejor condición de vida.

Su trabajo consiste en el servicio de transporte urbano local. Este trabajo lo realiza hace 13 años en el auto que un amigo le da en alquiler. Recorre las calles de la ciudad de principio a fin en busca de pasajeros, y gracias a sus cualidades de buen conversador y por su ánimo alegre tiene clientes fijos que lo llaman para contar con su servicio, además conoce muy bien las calles, avenidas y jirones de la ciudad. Y a pesar de que trabaja día y noche, también vende repuestos y accesorios de vehículos (llantas, rodajes y otras piezas), las ofrece de manera casual y vende por pedidos. En esta actividad también ha encontrado rentabilidad y con el desarrollo de ambas espera consolidarse en el rubro del transporte.
Lo que más le gusta de su labor es que sabe que tiene la oportunidad de progresar, le agrada sentir que las personas confían en él, y le gusta mucho recorrer las calles de la ciudad, aunque en ocasiones haya tenido que hacer frente a pasajeros desconsiderados que no han querido pagarle el precio justo, aun así sabe que ese es su trabajo y tiene que realizarlo. Espera más adelante poder comprar su propio auto y establecer un taller de ventas de autopartes, repuestos y accesorios.

Este es su tercer crédito número con MFP, está muy contento de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá más seguro de avanzar con su trabajo. Asimismo, se compromete, una vez más, a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas, como lo hizo en anteriores créditos. Y además está muy feliz de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son muy responsables y solidarios entre ellos.

El monto solicitado (S/.1500) lo invertirá en la refacción del vehículo con el que trabaja, y así también comprará artículos para la venta (llantas, rodajes, ejes, rotulas, amortiguadores y otras piezas).
texts.en:
Edgar is a 28 years old youth who is good, kind, and very hard-working.  Currently, he is separated from the woman he had been with for a year and with whom he had a daughter, who is now 1 year and 2 months.  He lives in a house that he rents and works a lot everyday to improve his financial situation and to be able to offer his daughter a better quality of life.

His work consists of providing local urban transportation services.  He has worked at this for 13 years in the car that his friend lends him.  He drives around the streets of the city with the goal of looking for passengers, and thanks to his skills as a good conversationalist and because of his joyful spirit, he has loyal customers who call him for his service.  In addition, he knows the streets, avenues, and alleys of the city.  Although he works day and night, he also sells spare parts and car accessories (rims, rotors, and others).  He offers them casually and sells by the order.  He has also found this side business to be profitable and with the development of both, he hopes to settle in the field of transportation.

What he likes most about his work is knowing that he has the opportunity to advance and he feels grateful that people trust in him.  He really enjoys driving the city streets, even though on occasions, he has had to face inconsiderate passengers who haven't wanted to pay him the fair price.  Still, he knows that this is part of his job and he has to carry on.  He hopes that in the future he will be able to purchase his own car and establish a shop selling car parts, spares, and accessories.

This is his third loan with MFP and he is content knowing that he has financial support, since this makes him feel more secure to advance with his job.  Likewise, he promises once again to complete his payments punctually, as he has done with the previous loans.  Moreover, he is happy to belong to his community bank, since all of the members are very responsible and supportive of each other.

He will invest the amount requested (S/.1500) in the repair of the vehicle he uses for work and also in some parts to sell (rims, rotors, axes, ball joints, shocks and other parts).

loans.use: to repair the car he uses for work and to purchase spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Bibiana

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de verduras y frutas,la socia vende manzanas,naranjas,platanos y uvas y tambien la socia vende zanahorias,tomates,lechugas y zapallos,la socia vende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia quiere salir adelante,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de fruta y verduras.La socia solicita el credito para comprar zanahorias,tomates y zapallos y tambien para comprar frutas como manzanas,naranjas,uvas y platanos.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Bibiana is continuing with her business selling fruits and vegetables.  She sells apples, oranges, bananas, grapes, carrots, tomatoes, lettuce and squash.  She works from 8am until 6pm, and it is through this business that she wants to get ahead.  Her dream is to expand her fruit and vegetable business.  She is requesting a loan that she will use to buy carrots, tomatoes and squash, and also fruit such as apples, oranges, grapes and bananas. 

Bibiana is happy to be getting this loan, and she promises to comply with the payment terms.

loans.use: to buy carrots, tomatoes and squash, and also fruit such as apples, oranges, grapes and bananas.

loans.name: Wahab

texts.en:
Wahab is a 25-year-old male with 1 child. He also looks after his younger brother, whom he pays fees for, in addition to meeting the needs of his aged parents. Wahab started a phone accessories shop in Lyantonde town after failing to find formal employment and thought that with the increased usage of phones among the rural population he would make some good income.

Wahab works 7 days a week in order to maximize profits. He has applied for a loan of UGX 1,000,000 to buy more accessories. Most of his clients are youths and a few people from the older generation.

Wahab is struggling hard to save money so that he can build himself a decent house. His main challenge is stiff competition coupled with limited capital. Wahab is a very hard working young man.

loans.use: to buy phone accessories.

loans.name: Nyame

texts.en: Nyame extracts palm oil and kernel oil, which she sells at Mfuom near Elmina. Nyame is married to a farmer and has 2 children. She uses her income to support her husband in feeding and clothing their children. Nyame will use her loan to purchase more palm fruit and kernel oil. With the new profit, she wishes to buy a machine so she can expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more palm fruit and palm kernels to extract and sell

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua is a petty trader. She operates a grocery shop at Mfuom near Abura, which she has done for 4 years now. She mostly sells different kinds of soft drinks and biscuits.  

She is married with 4 childern. Her husband is a mason. Ekua uses her income to support her husband to pay their utility bills. She will use her loan to purchase a variety of soft drinks to satisfy her customers. With the new profit, Ekua plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of stock items for her business

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia is a hairdresser at Mfuom near Abura. She is married and has 3 children. Felicia uses her income to support her husband in the general upkeep of their home. Her loan will be used to purchase hair creams, hair extentions, and hair dryers for her work. She hopes to use the new profits from her expanded business to buy even more dryers so she can serve her customers as quickly as possible.

loans.use: to purchase hair creams, hair extentions, and hair dryers for her business

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is into gari production (gari is a couscous-like grain made out of grated cassava). Ama sells the gari at Mfuom near Abura, which she has done for 5 years now. She is married to a farmer and has 5 children. She uses her income to support her husband to pay their accommodation and utility bills. Ama will use her loan to purchase cassava to prouduce her gari to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase cassava to produce gari to sell

loans.name: Maame

texts.en:
Maame operates a grocery shop at Mfuom near Abura. She has done this for 3 years now. In her shop, she sells milk, Milo, sugar, soups, different kinds of soft drinks, canned tometoes, canned fish, biscuits, toffees, powdered milk, and others.  

She is married with 3 children. Her husband is a farmer. Maame uses her income to support her husband to pay the utility bills. She will use her loan to purchase a variety of groceries to sell. With the new profit, Maame plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of groceries to sell

loans.name: Maame

texts.en: Maame extracts palm oil and kernel oil, which she sells at Mfuom near Elmina. Maame is married. She uses her income to support her husband in paying their accommodation bills. Maame will use her loan to purchase more palm fruit and palm kernels. With the new profit she wishes to buy a machine that can extract the oil so she can expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more palm fruit and palm kernels to extract oil for sale

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a 54-year-old married man. He has 4 children with ages ranging from 12 years to 20 years. He describes himself to be aggressive, honest, and courageous. He operates a rental homes business where he provides rental house services to customers. He has been involved in this business for 20 years. Samuel is also a blacksmith. His business is located in a conducive business environment and his primary customers are local residents. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to pay for the renovation of the rental houses. His business goal is to buy more plots for hire within 5 years.

loans.use: to pay for the renovation of rental houses

loans.name: Maame

texts.en: Maame is a petty trader. She sells vegetables like garden eggs (also known as African eggplant), peppers, tomatoes and onions; salted fish and other food items in Mfuom near Abura. Maame has been in this business for some time now. She wishes to buy other food items that her customers are requesting. She will use a loan from Kiva to buy salted fish and vegetables. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy salted fish and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Florencio

texts.es:
Florencio, estudió solo hasta la secundaria y actualmente trabaja como conductor por más de diez horas al día y fines de semana toda la noche ya que debe cubrir los gastos de educación, alimentación y servicios básicos de su familia
Florencio es casado y tiene cuatro hijos que están en etapa escolar, viven en casa propia ocupando tres habitaciones, es por eso que solicita el crédito para  la compra de ladrillos, cemento, arena, para la  construcción de  dos habitaciones más ya que tiene varios hijos y desea darles más comodidad.
El sueño de Florencio, es tener más ingresos y mejorar la construcción de su vivienda dándole un acabado fino de esta forma mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la primera vez que el cliente solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Florencio only went to school up until high school.  He currently works as a driver for over ten hours a day and all night on the week-ends.  He does this because he needs to cover his family’s expenses for education, food, and basic services.

Florencio is married and has four school age children.  They live in their own house, occupying three rooms.  That is why he is requesting the loan to buy bricks, cement, and sand to build two more rooms.  He has several children, and he wants to make them more comfortable.

Florencio’s dream is to have more income and to improve the construction of his house.  He wants to put finishing touches on the house, which will improve their quality of life.

This is the first time that he has requested a loan from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, and sand to build two more rooms.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 50-year-old married man. He has a son who is 24 years old. He describes himself to be aggressive, honest, and focused. He operates a retail business where he sells beverages and food spices. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in a strategically-placed business environment and his primary customers are police. He describes his biggest business challenge to be shortages of raw material used for making beverages and spices. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more beverages and spices for resale. His business goal is to expand his business in to the East African region.

loans.use: to buy more beverages and spices for resale

loans.name: Augustus

texts.en: Augustus is a 42-year-old married man. He has 4 children with ages ranging from 9 years to 22 years. He describes himself to be honest and disciplined. He operates a pub where he sells beer. He has been involved in this business for 22 years and employs 2 staff members. His business is located in a strategic business area and his primary customers are adults. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insecurity within the area. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy beer. His business goal is to improve his pub business within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will use the anticipated profits generated in buying a farm and building rental houses.

loans.use: to buy more beer to sell at his pub

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 29-year-old married man. He has a daughter who is 4 years old. He describes himself to be honest and persistent. He operates a beauty salon and a charcoal retail store where he provides hair services and sells charcoal. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located near a busy road and his primary customers are women. He describes his biggest business challenge to sometimes have low purchasing power. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy beauty products and charcoal. His business goal is to open a new retail shop within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have had expanded his retail business.

loans.use: to buy beauty products and charcoal

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a hairdresser in Mfuom near Abura. She is married and has three children. Beatrice uses her income to support her husband in paying for their accommodation and utility bills. Her loan will be used to purchase hair creams, hair extensions, and a hair dryer for her work. She hopes to use the new profit from her loan to expand her business further.

loans.use: to purchase hair creams, hair extensions, and hair dryer for her work

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a 36-year-old married man. He has 4 children with ages ranging from 9 months to 12 years. He describes himself to be an honest and God-fearing man. He operates a retail store where he sells household items such as sugar, cooking oil, flour, blue band, cosmetics, milk, and sodas. He has been involved in this business for 12 years. His business is located in a strategic business area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be poor sanitation within the area. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more home products. His business goal is to run a permanent wholesale shop within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will diversify into a manufacturing business.

loans.use: to buy household items to sell

loans.name: Joan

texts.en: Joan is a married woman. She has 2 children with ages ranging from 6 years to 13 years. She describes herself to be diligent. She operates a food stall where she sells fish. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a busy market and her primary customers are residents and retailers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high price for fish. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a cooling box, fish preservatives, and more fish for selling. Her business goal is to be a supplier of fish across the whole country within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will use the anticipated profits in buying a piece of land and building a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy a cooling box, fish preservatives, and fish for resale

loans.name: David Antonio

texts.es: David Antonio  de 31 años de edad, casado con un hijo menor  tiene por actividad económica la venta de verduras actividad a la que se dedica hace  cuatro años, el cual lo tiene ubicado en el mercado de su localidad, en la actualidad ha podido mantener el negocio de forma rentable para la mantención de su familia el cual ha sido muy productivo gracias a su responsabilidad y el apoyo que león 2000 le ha brindado, el financiamiento lo quiere para comprar verduras como: ayote, pipián, tomates, cebollas, chillonas, chayote, pipían de mantequilla, plátanos, papas, entre otros.
texts.en:
David Antonio is 31 years old, married, and has a young son. His business is selling vegetables at a market in his town, which he has done for four years. At the moment, he wants to maintain a profitable business so that he can sustain his family. David has been very productive thanks to his responsibility and the support provided by Fundación León 2000.

He is requesting a loan in order to buy produce such as acorn squash, pumpkins, tomatoes, onions, bell peppers, chayote, butternut squash, bananas, potatoes, and other items.

loans.use: to buy acorn squash, pumpkins, tomatoes, onions, bell peppers, chayote, butternut squash, bananas, potatoes, and other produce.

loans.name: Alicia Alejandrina

texts.es:
Doña Alicia tiene 60 años de edad, es soltera por viudez, vive con dos hijos y dos nietos en un barrio de la ciudad de Olanchito, Yoro.
Doña Alicia, hace seis años decidió tener su propia fuente de ingresos para cubrir los gastos del hogar y ayudar a su familia. Ella estableció una pulpería en su casa donde vende productos de la canasta básica como ser: arroz, azúcar, huevos, refrescos, carnes, lácteos, etc. ella quiere mantener surtido su negocio y aumentar las ventas, para eso solicita un préstamo por 25,000.00 lempiras el cual es el segundo préstamo que solicita a ODEF, y va a comprar productos comestibles para surtir la pulpería y poder ofrecer a sus clientes. A ella le gustaría en un futuro ampliar el local para que su negocio tenga mejor presentación y surtirlo más.
texts.en:
Doña Alicia is 60 years old and single as a result of being a widow. She lives with two children and two grandchildren in a neighborhood of the city of Olanchito, Yoro.

Six years ago, Doña Alicia decided to have her own source of income so that she could cover the household expenses and help her family. She established a grocery store in her house where she sells everyday products such as rice, sugar, eggs, soft drinks, meat, dairy products, and other items. Alicia wants to maintain the inventory of her business and increase her sales, so she is requesting a loan of 25,000 HNL.

This is the second loan she has requested from ODEF and she will use it to buy food products to stock her store so that she can offer merchandise to her customers. In the future, she would like to expand the location for her business so that it can have a better appearance and more inventory.

loans.use: to buy dairy products, basic grains, sausages, sugar, and other food items.

loans.name: Carmela

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORICHUSPA”; La socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco, del departamento de Cusco.

La  socia Carmela;continua dedicandose a la repostería, la socia se dedica a la elaboracion de caritas pintadas para las distintas fiestas infantiles donde solicitan sus servicios,la socia lleva buen tiempo en este su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el prestamo para la compra de materiales como pinceles.


La socia agradece el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Carmela belongs to the Qorichuspa communal bank.  She lives in the Huanchac district in the Cusco province, Cusco department.

Carmela continues to work as a confectioner.   She decorates cakes with colored characters for different children’s parties when her services are requested.  She has had her business for a good amount of time, and thanks to her daily effort, it is going well for her.  This is the way that she gets her family ahead.

She  requested the loan to buy materials like brushes.  She is grateful for the loan that was granted, and she pledges to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy materials like brushes.

loans.name: Sycomore 1 Group

texts.en:
Stephane, age 38, is married and has two children, ages 10 and 19. He also provides for his father. Stephane is representing the Sycomore 1 group. He sells sandals in a local market in Brazzaville. He has had this business for one year. He will use the loan to buy more sandals to sell. His business strategy is to keep his stand clean and the sandals organized. He also has competitive prices and is willing to negotiate with a customer to agree upon the best price.  
Stephane has received two previous loans from Kiva’s partner, HOPE Congo. He has a good repayment record. He hopes to continue to expand and become a large sandal business. He would like to travel abroad and buy sandals in order to obtain a better price and a wider variety of sandals. He wants to send his children abroad to study as well.

loans.use: to pay for sandals to resell

loans.name: Sycomore 2 Group

texts.en:
Bertrand, age 40, is married and has four children, three of which are still in school. He also cares for his father. He is representing the Sycomore 2 group. Bertrand is a basket weaver and has been selling his work for eight years. He weaves straw and thin pieces of wood to make baskets, stools, chairs, and bags. He will use the loan to buy basket weaving materials, including straw, thin pieces of wood, and other kinds of wood. 
Bertrand has received two previous loans with Kiva’s partner, HOPE Congo. He has a good repayment record. His hope is to use some of his profits to assist his children in their education.

loans.use: to pay for basket weaving materials, including strips of wood, sticks, and straw.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be a principled man. He operates a motorbike where he provides transportation. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located at a busy area and his primary customers are passengers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high cost of fuel. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy motorcycle spare parts. His business goal is to buy a taxi to increase the mode of transportation within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have had more motorbikes to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: Juana Elvia

texts.es:
Juana, se dedica a la venta de papas fritas, panes con salchichas, hamburguesas, vive con su familia es madre de tres hijos, este negocio ella lo administra en un coche el cual lo instala afuera de su vivienda todas las tardes, cuenta ya con una preferencia de algunos vecinos de la zona.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para comprarse los materiales para el negocio como el gas, el aceite, las papas, pan, condimentos, carnes y salchicha, este crédito le ayudará para mejorar la disponibilidad de productos y poder aumentar la producción.
La aspiración de Juana es un futuro comprarse un lote donde poder construir su propia casa, donde puedan recidir sus hijos más cómodamente.
texts.en:
Juana sells French fries, bread with sausages, and hamburgers.  She has three children, and she lives with her family.  She runs the business from a cart that she sets up outside of her house every afternoon.  Many of her neighbors prefer her business.

She is requesting a loan to buy materials for her business.  She will buy things like gas, oil, potatoes, bread, condiments, meat, and sausages.  This loan will help her improve the availability of her products, and she will be able to increase the production.

Juana’s aspiration for the future is to buy a lot where she would be able to build her own house and where her children would be able to live more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy gas, oil, potatoes, bread, condiments, meat, and sausages.

loans.name: Silvio Jose

texts.es: Silvio José de 65 años de edad tiene por  actividad económica venta de pan. Hace más de 11 años que se dedica a este negocio. Con estos ingresos mantiene a su familia él ha logrado salir adelante con mucho esfuerzo uno de sus desafíos es el tiempo ya que tiene demanda de clientes y esto le proporciona mucho cansancio. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de semita, picos, pan simple, empanadas y otras. Esto lo ha logrado gracias al apoyo que  león 2000 le ha brindado.
texts.en:
Silvio José is 65 years old and earns his living by selling bread. He has been in this business for more than 11 years. With his earnings, he has been able to sustain his family and continue forward with great effort. One of his challenges at the moment is keeping up with the demand from his customers, which has caused him a great amount of fatigue.

This loan will be used as operating capital for buying pastries, sweet bread, plain bread, empanadas, and other items. He will be able to accomplish this thanks to the support Fundación León 2000 has provided.

loans.use: to buy pastries, sweet bread, plain bread, empanadas, and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy  more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de ropa como pantalones,casacas,blusas y chompas,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia quiere salir adelante,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de ropa.La socia solicita el credito para comprar polos,chompas y blusas.
texts.en: Nancy is continuing with her business selling clothing, including pants, jackets, blouses and sweaters.  She works from 8am until 6pm, and she wants to get ahead through this business.  Nancy's dream is to expand her business selling clothing.  She is requesting a loan to buy polo shirts, sweaters and blouses.

loans.use: to buy polo shirts, sweaters and blouses

loans.name: Ana Lilian

texts.es:
Ana, se dedica a la venta de chancletas de baño y sandalias, vive solamente con su hija quien depende económicamente de ella, el negocio de Ana está instalado en el mercado, cuenta con un local donde ofrece la mercadería para niñas y para adultos desde hace cuatro años.
Ella solicita un préstamo para poderlo invertir en mercadería para el negocio, comprándose una variedad de chancletas y sandalias con estilos nuevos, este préstamo ayudará a mejorar la variedad y a poderle ofrecer a los clientes lo más necesario.
Su objetivo es crecer en el negocio a través del financiamiento y también poder apoyar a  su hija.
texts.en:
Ana has a business selling flip-flops and sandals.  She lives only with her daughter, who is financially dependent upon her.  Ana sells her merchandise from a stall that she has in a market.  She has been selling merchandise here for children and adults for 4 years.  

She is requesting a loan to invest in merchandise for her business.  She will use the loan to buy a variety of flip-flops and sandals in the newest styles.  This loan will help her to increase the variety of her products, so she can offer her customers what they need.

Her goal is to grow her business through this financing, and also be able to support her daughter.

loans.use: to buy flip-flops and sandals in the newest styles

loans.name: Jose Mauricio

texts.es:
José, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo para poder realizar la inversión en la sastrería, comprandose una variedad en telas para confeccionar pantalones, pues tiene un contrato con los centros escolares y este préstamo le ayudará para poder cumplir en los plazos.
El manifiesta que el préstamo anterior fue un gran apoyo ya que logró comprarse los materiales necesarios para la costura, ha logrado salir con sus compromisos y hasta el momento se encuentra estable en el taller, espera seguir siendo productivo y poder tener mayor capacidad de respuesta.
texts.en:
José has decided to request a new loan so that he can invest in his tailoring shop. He will buy a variety of fabrics for making trousers since he has a contract with the central school system. This loan will help him complete the order on time.

José says that his previous loan was a great help since he was able to buy necessary materials for sewing. He has been able to fulfill his commitments and now has a stable business. He hopes to remain productive and have better capacity to respond to orders.

loans.use: to buy fabrics.

loans.name: Amor Y Esperanza 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Alfonzo is one of the members of the group called Amor y Esperanza (Love and Hope) 1, 2 & 3. This group is located in the rural area surrounding La Romana, where the sugarcane harvest and tourist industry dominate the economy. He makes his home in a simple structure with his two children and his wife. He says that his most important duty is to work hard by selling more products to provide for his family.

Alfonzo is excited to be taking his sixth loan with Esperanza, having repaid his previous loans and grown his business. He plans to use this loan to invest in his business by buying shoes, clothes and cosmetics such as body lotion, perfume, deodorant and other products. He will reinvest the profits in his business and take home money for food, clothes and other needs. His future plans are to develop a successful business within his local area. He thanks you all for your support!!!

loans.use: to buy miscellaneous products (shoes, cosmetics, clothes).

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es:
Gustavo tiene 24 años, es un joven padre de familia muy amable, sencillo y con la vitalidad que le impulsa a seguir adelante en el logro de sus metas. Vive en casa de sus padres junto a su pareja Mariela, de 18 años, y sus dos queridos hijos: Ken de 3 años y Andrea de tan solo un añito. Es por ellos que a diario trabaja arduamente, ya que desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida.

Su trabajo consiste en la compra y venta de pescado fresco, realiza esta actividad desde hace 5 años con la ayuda de tres colaboradores, quienes se encargan de apoyarlo en la selección, traslado y venta de los pescados. Así puede mantener a su familia tranquila y brindándoles lo que necesitan. Su constante ánimo de superación ha hecho que incursione en este negocio y poco a poco se ha hecho muy conocido, ya que vende el pescado más fresco y sabroso del mercado y siempre recibe a sus clientes con una sonrisa. Por otro lado, alquila un motocarro, el cual le proporciona un ingreso adicional o en ocasiones él mismo lo maneja por las tardes. Al principio le fue muy complicado adaptarse a la rutina porque no conocía bien el negocio, pero con el pasar del tiempo empezó a consolidarse.
Lo que más le gusta de su labor es conversar con sus clientes, considera que lo más difícil es soportar el intenso olor, pues se impregna en la ropa y en el cuerpo, a pesar de ello espera tener en el futuro un vehículo acondicionado que le permita transportar y conservar sus productos frescos por mucho más tiempo.

Este es su crédito número 4 con MFP, por tanto agradece la oportunidad y confianza que ponen en él. Por otro lado, se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual, Y además le agrada ser parte del banco comunal al que pertenece, ya que ha visto que sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias.

Con el monto solicitado (S/.2000) comprará más pescado de diferentes especies y de los mejores tamaños.  También dará mantenimiento a su vehículo, comprando algunas piezas y pagando al mecánico que le hará el trabajo.
texts.en:
Gustavo, 24, is a kind, humble, young father with a vitality that propels him to achieve his goals. He lives at home with his parents and wife Mariela, 18, and their two beloved children: 3-year-old Ken and 1-year-old Andrea. He has been working very hard every day on their behalf so that he can provide them with better circumstances.

For five years, he has been buying and selling fresh fish, working with three co-workers who help him select, transport, and sell the fish. He has been able to comfortably maintain his family and provide for theirs needs this way. His constant desire to succeed led him to undertake this business, and little by little he has become well known for selling the freshest, most delicious fish in the market and always greeting his customers with a smile. He also rents out a motorcar, which is an additional source of income, and he occasionally drives in the afternoons. At first he found it difficult to adapt to the routine because he didn't understand the business well, but over time he has begun to find his footing. 

Conversing with his customers is what he likes most about his job; the most difficult aspect of it is putting up with the intense odor that remains on his clothes and skin. He hopes that he will one day have an air conditioned vehicle to transport and store his fresh products for longer periods of time.

This is his fourth loan cycle with MFP, and he is grateful for the opportunities and confidence the institution places in him. For his part, he promises to make his payments promptly. He also is happy to belong to his communal bank, as he regards its members as responsible and caring people. He will use the requested loan amount (S/.2000) to buy more varieties and sizes of fish. He will also do maintenance on his vehicle, buying some parts and paying the mechanic who will do the work.

loans.use: to buy more varieties and sizes of fish.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en: For the past year Elsie, a 29-year-old married mother of three, has been running a small business selling BBQ in her community. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital and is now requesting a loan to expand her enterprise through the purchase of an oven, chickens, lamb flaps, sausages, etc.   Elsie will be better able to support her family through this expansion.

loans.use: to buy BBQ oven, chickens, lamb flaps, sausages, etc.

loans.name: Brenda Vanessa

texts.es:
Brenda, se dedica a la costureria, vive con su suegra y su hija, ella realiza sus trabajos de confección de blusas y faldas, también elabora matatas y algunas prendas de Croche, esto ha surgido por iniciativa propia buscando la alternativa para generar mayores utilidades a su familia.
Ella solicita un préstamo para poder realizar la compra de una máquina de coser, este préstamo será una gran ayuda pues le dará una nueva herramienta donde pueda ofrecer un mayor servicio en la confección de ropa a sus clientes.
El  objetivo de ella es buscar la alternativa para poder crecer en el taller, con esta inversión obtendrá una nueva herramienta de la cual espera hacer un buen uso que le permite tener más trabajo.
texts.en:
Brenda operates a tailoring business.  She lives with her mother-in-law and daughter.  She makes and sells blouses, skirts and other pieces of clothing.  She started the business because she needed a way to support her family.  
Brenda will use this loan to buy a sewing machine.  The investment will provide her with the tools she needs to operate her business.  She wants to grow her business and your loan will help her do so.

loans.use: to buy a sewing maching for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios, a 48-year-old married mother of three children ranging in age from 21 to 24, raises hogs to help meet the needs of her family. She plans to use her loan to buy hog feed to fatten her hogs, hoping to produce healthy animals that will attract buyers at the market and sell at a good price.

Remedios intends to increase the number of hogs she is raising in the future to ensure greater business stability.

loans.use: to buy feed for hogs.

loans.name: Mujeres Capacitadas 2 & 3 Group

texts.en: Justa is the coordinator of her group Mujeres Capacitadas (Capable Women) 2 & 3. Her group is located in Puerto Plata, a northern port town whose economy is dependent on tourism. She makes her home there in a simple structure as a single mother with four children. Justa is excited to be taking out her ninth loan with Esperanza after having fully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling chicharrones (fried pork fat) and clothing by purchasing pork, different clothes and underwear to sell. She says, thanks to her loans, she has been able to established her business and expanded it. With every loan, she has increased her sales and inventory. She will use her profits to continue improving her house. With her past benefits and savings, it has been possible to rebuild her house, little by little, while she continues to sell and develop her business. Justa thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: to buy clothes and food for her fried food stall.

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es: La señora  María es  una  persona  muy  responsable  y  trabajadora  la cual se  dedica  a la  venta  de  diferentes  productos como pantalones  y   ropa  interior  de  los  cuales   realiza  la venta  por catalogo, se acerco a la  institución  ya  que  en  este  momento   requiere   realizar la  compra  de  mercancía  para   su   negocio  ya  que    su mayor  sueño  es  hacerlo  crecer,  agradece  el  apoyo  brindado  para la  realización  de  su proyecto ya  que  le proporcionara la  posibilidad de  ofrecer a  su  familia  una  excelente  estabilidad  económica.
texts.en: Sra. Maria is a responsible and hard-working person. She operates a clothing sales business.  She buys clothing--pants, underwear, etc.--from a catalog for resale to her customers.  She will use this loan to stock her business.  Her greatest wish is to grow the business.  She says that she is grateful to you for providing the resources she needs to carry out her plan.  The investment will make it possible for her to better support her family.

loans.use: to stock her clothing sales business.

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Kim, a 25-year-old married woman who resides in Baray district, Kompong Tom province, is a loving and responsible mother of two young children. She grows rice and potatoes on her own farmland, which generates income for the family, while her husband is in the business of transporting firewood throughout the district for sale. Kim and her husband strive to work hard to generate more income so they can use some to pay for the construction of their new house.

Kim is requesting a loan of KHR 6,000,000 to add to her existing capital to purchase timbers, wooden boards and roof tiles. With these purchases, she will be able to get her house finished in the next few months. She hopes that she will have a comfortable house for family living.

loans.use: to purchase timbers, wooden boards and roof tiles.

loans.name: Victorina

texts.es:
Victorina, Está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, para el fortalecimiento de su negocio, pues ella a través  de los préstamos realiza muchas gestiones que le ayudan a mejorar, por ejemplo este préstamo será invertido en la compra de ganado de reparto así como también comida como el concentrado para estos animales, ella considera que esta nueva inversión será una oportunidad para  crecer.
El efecto que tuvo con su préstamo anterior fue el mejoramiento del servicio de transporte, con el que ella trabaja, ya que le reparó y hasta el momento ha podido realizar su trabajo de una manera normal y con prontitud, gracias a esta inversión ha mejorado y ha recuperado algunos clientes con el servicio que nuevamente está ofreciendo.
texts.en:
Our member, Victorina, is applying for a loan that she will use to support her livestock business.  Past loans have helped her grow her business and  she will use this one to buy more head of cattle and animal feed.  She says that the investment will allow her to continue growing her business.
She used her last loan to help [someone?--not clear] improve the transportation services that she uses.  They were able to make the repairs that were needed to again provide a reliable service.  Thanks to the investment, she has managed to win back some customers because she can now provide a better service.

loans.use: to buy cattle and feed for her livestock business.
