loans.name: Candelaria De Jesus

texts.es:
Candelaria, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para poderla invertir en variedad de ropa para damas caballeros y niños como camisas, faldas, ropa interior, que son los más demandados por los clientes, Este será una nueva ayuda con la que su negocio se verá beneficiado.
Ella considera que el préstamo anterior le permitió incrementar el inventario de mercadería, al mismo tiempo poderle ofrecer a los clientes una mayor variedad de la cual ella aumentó sus ventas, en su familia sus condiciones están mejorando a través del desarrollo del negocio.
texts.en:
Candelaria is applying for a loan that she will use to stock her clothing sales business.  She will use the investment to buy the merchandise that her customers most want: shirts for men, women and children; skirts; underwear; etc.  The loan will help her to grow the business.  
Candelaria tells us that past loans allowed her to increase the range of merchandise she had for sale.  She was able to offer a wider variety of merchandise which, in turn, led to more sales.  Developing the business is important to her because it is her means of helping her family.

loans.use: to stock her clothing sales business.

loans.name: Juan De  Dios

texts.es: Juan  es  una  persona  trabajadora  y  muy  responsable  el cual  se  dedica  a la  venta  de  botas y prendas  de  vestir,  este   negocio le permite  generar   ingresos   para  salir  adelante   día  con día, el  se acerco  con nosotros  debido a  que  ya  a  tenido créditos    en la institución y a  lo largos  de  estos  se  a  distinguido  por  tener una excelente  cultura  de  pagos,  en esta  ocasión requiere   realizar  la compra de  mercancía para  seguir  trabajando , ve  en el crédito la posibilidad  de  hacer  crecer  su  negocio   y  de  seguir  ofreciendo a sus  clientes  el excelente servicio que  lo  a caracterizado
texts.en: Juan is a responsible and hard-working person.  He operates a business selling boots and other clothing.  The business generates the income he needs to get ahead in the world.  He approached our institution because he has received loans from us in the past and knows that we know that he has an excellent repayment record.  He is applying for a loan that he will use to stock his retail business.  He sees the investment as a means to grow his business and continue offering his customers the high level of service that he has long provided.

loans.use: to stock his retail business.

loans.name: Estela

texts.en: Estela is 41 years old and lives in Sikatuna, Bohol. She is married with five children, three of whom are still dependents. For five years now, Estela is engaged in raising a native chicken in her small barn. She would like to request a loan so she can buy feed for her chicken and possibly buy new chicks to raise. In the future, she also plans to save so she can buy cattle for additional income. This in turn will help in raising her family with her husband who works as a laborer.

loans.use: to buy feed for her chicken

loans.name: Marta Rubidia

texts.es:
Marta, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para poderlo invertir nuevamente en productos cosméticos de revistas, también invertirá una parte en prendas de vestir, los productos son lociones, talcos, cremas, blusas y faldas, ya que son productos que logra venderlos más fácilmente.
Su efecto fue favorable con el préstamo anterior ya que ha agregado un nuevo rubro al negocio, esperando con este poder ir prosperando en el mercado, sus condiciones familiares se han mantenido, pero por su parte ha tenido los ingresos necesarios para cubrir las necesidades y el alimento que demandan.
texts.en:
Marta is requesting a new loan, to again invest in cosmetics sold by catalog. She will also use part of it to buy articles of clothing. The products are lotions, powders, creams, blouses and skirts, as they are the items that she manages to sell the easiest. 

The previous loan had a positive effect, as she has added a new line to the business, hoping to begin to prosper in the market this way. Her family's situation has remained the same, but for her part, she has had the income she needs to cover the food and other necessities they require.

loans.use: To buy lotions, powders, creams, blouses and skirts.

loans.name: San Blás Group

texts.es:
El comité San Blas se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Santaní. Ellas tienen sus ocupaciones individuales, pero también trabajan juntas para poder fomentar su compañerismo. Son jefas de familia que desean poder ayudar a sus familias dándoles un mejor futuro del que ellas tuvieron.
Basilisa es una de estas mujeres, que vio en el programa de comité una gran ayuda, pues también recibe capacitaciones y le ayuda a poder usar mejor sus créditos. Ella se dedica al comercio, ya que tiene una despensita bien surtida, con los artículos de primera necesidad, y es justamente para abastecer su negocio que solicita este préstamo, ya que quiere comprar azúcar, harina, aceites, panificados y otros insumos para poder abastecer bien su negocio.
Basilisa y sus compañeras agradecen por esta oportunidad que están recibiendo, pues les será muy útil el crédito en sus negocios.
texts.en:
The "San Blas" communal bank was formed by the coming together of several neighbors in the city of Santaní. They have their individual occupations, but also work together to foster their collective progress. They are parents who wish to be able to help their families by giving them a better future than they had.

Basilisa is one of these women who saw the communal bank program as a great source of help. She also receives training and it helps her to make better use of her loans. 

She is a businessperson, as she has a small grocery store, well stocked with basic household necessities. It is precisely in order to stock her shop that she is requesting this loan, as she wants to buy sugar, flour, cooking oils, baked goods and other supplies so that she can stock her business well. 

Basilisa and her co-members are grateful for the opportunity that they are receiving, as the loan will be very useful in their businesses.

loans.use: To buy sugar, flour, cooking oils, baked goods and other supplies.

loans.name: Jeannette De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Jeannette, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para el fortalecimiento del negocio, pues manifiesta tener poca disponibilidad de materiales para la confección de ropa, esto la ha motivado a continuar trabajando a través de los préstamos y poder invertir en la compra de tela de diferentes colores, hilos, broches, que le ayudará en la confección de faldas y pantalones.

Ella ha tenido un efecto positivo con el préstamo anterior, pues hasta el momento cuenta con una nueva máquina de coser que es la que le está ayudando para poder aumentar la producción.
texts.en:
Jeannette is requesting a new loan to strengthen her business.  She says that she does not have much fabric available for making her clothing and this has led her to continue working with loans so that she can invest in buying different colored fabrics, threads and fasteners.  This will help her to make her skirts and pants.

Jeannette's previous loan had a positive effect as she now has a new sewing machine which is helping her to increase her production.

loans.use: to buy different colored fabrics, threads and fasteners

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
El comité Kuña Katupyry  está en el 1er Ciclo con 10  integrantes, es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unidas, solidarias y responsable. Ellas están muy emocionadas de formar parte del grupo de la fundación, y se comprometen a trabajar juntas.
Liduvina es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, siempre lucha arduamente por salir adelante y darle todo lo que necesitan a los suyos. Ella se dedica a la cría de animales, como ser gallinas, cerdos, ovejas y demás en lo cual le va muy bien, ya que siempre pudo mucha habilidad para esto. Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de balanceados para sus animales, para que tenga en stock y de esa forma no le falte. Agradece por la oportunidad que ella y su grupo esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Kuña Katupyry" is in its first loan cycle with 10 members.  This group stands out in the neighborhood for being very united, supportive and responsible.  They are very excited to be part of a group associated with the Fundacion, and they are committed to working together.  

Liduvina is a very hardworking and enterprising woman.  She always fights hard to get ahead and provide for the needs of her family.  She has a business raising animals, such as hens, pigs, sheep and other animals, and it is going very well, because she has always been very skilled in this line of work.  She is requesting a loan to buy nutritionally balanced feed for her animals, so that she will have it on hand and can avoid running out of it.  She is grateful for the opportunity that she and her group are receiving.

loans.use: to buy animal feed

loans.name: Rosa Luz

texts.es:
La socia se dedica al negocio de crianza de animales como gallinas,pollos y gallos,la socia los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias que existe,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar y mejorar el negocio de crianza de animales.La socia solicita el credito para comprar gallos,gallinas y pollos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member's business is raising animals such as hens, chickens and roosters.  She fattens her animals and then sells them at different markets.  She works from 8.00am to 5.00pm and, through this business, she provides for her children.  Her dream is to expand and improve her animal raising business.   She is requesting a loan to buy roosters, hens and chickens.

This member is happy to be receiving her loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy roosters, hens and chickens

loans.name: Rinelda

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Rinelda works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Rinelda is borrowing a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing net and other equipment.

Rinelda has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and other equipment.

loans.name: Korng

texts.en:
Korng, age 19, is a young married woman who has a lovely young kid. She helps her husband generate additional income with her fish-selling business  as well as hog-raising business. She raises a few pigs for both slaughter and offspring in a wooden piggery in her backyard. However, she manages this business only when she gets free time from selling fish at a local market. Also, her husband helps her look after the pigs aside from his business of providing rice-husking services to local people in their neighborhood.
She is now asking for a loan of KHR 600,000 to purchase fish in bulk to sell in her store. This will have a good impact on her business and improve her family’s living condition. In years to come, Korng wants to save money for the future growth of her business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase fish in bulk to sell in her store.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en: Maricel is a hardworking entrepreneur with a fishing business in the Philippines. She is requesting a loan of PHP 19000 through NWTF to buy a new engine for her fishing boat. NWTF is listing Maricel's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Punsalmaa

texts.en:
Punsalmaa is 65 years old and lives with her son in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Ulaanbaatar City, Mongolia. Her two elder sons live separately while her younger son helps her with her business. 

She was an accountant and an economic expert in a provision company in Ulaanbaatar City.  Recently, she retired from her job and started running her own provision business, a grocery trading business. Even though she's fairly old for the business, she's very energetic and is managing it well. 

She would like to sell a range of products in her new business successfully. She's a hard working woman who says "Even though I'm old I never want to burden somebody and I love my work." She's requesting 700,000 MNT to buy grocery products for her store.

loans.use: To buy grocery products for her store.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para poder iniciar un nuevo cultivo de tomates, invirtiendo en un invernadero, para esto deberá comprarse tela de Maya, semillas de tomates y de chiles, abono y una vez esté la producción también deberá tener para el transporte, ésta será una gran ayuda de la cual espera recibir abundante producción.
Con el préstamo anterior logró tener una buena siembra de ejotes, tomates  y otros vegetales que le han ayudado hasta el momento a mantenerse, pues ha realizado buenas ventas a los clientes y en estos últimos meses ha logrado construir una pequeña casa de adobe donde vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos
texts.en:
Juan is requesting a new loan so that he can sow his new crop of tomatoes.  He will invest in a greenhouse.  For this he will buy Mayan cloth, tomato seeds, chili seeds and fertilizer.  Once he is growing his crops he will also need to pay for transportation.  This will be a great help and he hopes that it will provide him with good yields.

Juan's previous loan enabled him to enjoy a good yield of green beans, tomatoes and other vegetables.  This helped him to support himself as he experienced good sales and, over the last few months, he has managed to build a small adobe house where he now lives together with his wife and his two children.

loans.use: to buy Mayan cloth, tomato seeds, chili seeds, and fertilizer

loans.name: Ey

texts.en:
This is Ey, 34 years old and a diligent woman who has been living in the Baray district of Kompong Tom province. She is married to Moun, a soldier, and a father of three children. Her husband doesn’t often live with her because he has to work and live in a military garrison, which is a very far distance from the province. So Ey lives with her three children and is highly responsible for the family. These days, she operates both crops and hog husbandry at the same time with some help from her children. She has been in the business for more than 10 years, and earns approximately 5.50 USD each day. 

She is now asking for a loan from HKL and Kiva to purchase six heads of pig to raise for future sale. With the remaining funds, she will pay for the labor costs of working on her two hectares of potato plantation. She hopes to expand her businesses in the future.

loans.use: to purchase six heads of pig to raise for future sale.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 35 years old. She is married to Jesus, who is a carpenter, and they were blessed with two children. To add to her spouse's income, Marites raises hogs to sell. She usually gains about 3,000 Philippines pesos (P) with each hog sold. The family's income was just enough to support their needs, especially for the school expenses of their children. 

Marites is now asking for a loan of P4,000 to buy hog feed and medicines for sustainability of her hogs. Someday, she hopes to offer the raised hogs at a higher cost, leading to the increase of her income, too.

loans.use: to buy hog feed and medicines for sustainability of her hogs.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita tiene 28 años, es una mujer amable y bondadosa, trabaja mucho ya que desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su pequeño hijo de 2 años y 8 meses. Su pareja es Ricardo, de 40 años, y con él trabaja mucho para poder salir adelante. Viven en casa de sus padres, ya que están en proceso de comprar su casa propia.

Su negocio es el alquiler de un auto, gracias al optimismo que siempre demostró y a su afán por superarse día a día, ha trabajado en varias actividades y de cada oportunidad laboral que ha podido tener llegó a ahorrar durante mucho tiempo con lo que pudo comprar el primer vehículo que tanto anhelaba, el cual ahora ha puesto a trabajar como taxi. Lleva en esta actividad un poco más de 3 años y gracias a esto sus ingresos han mejorado y ha podido solucionar algunas carencias que antes había en su hogar. 
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, como dueña del auto, es que le permite viajar constantemente y disfrutar de los paisajes de su zona; lo más difícil es tener que madrugar para cumplir con los horarios de salida, sabe que el trabajo es arduo pero comprende que a mediano plazo cosechará los mejores frutos de su esfuerzo. Para más adelante espera comprar otro carro y seguir en el camino del progreso.

Este es el crédito número 7 con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá más segura de avanzar con su trabajo. Asimismo se compromete, una vez más, a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas como lo hizo en anteriores créditos. Y está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son muy responsables y solidarios entre sí.

Con el monto solicitado (S/. 1500) comprará algunos repuestos y mandará su vehículo al taller automotriz para su revisión semestral.
texts.en:
Margarita is 28 years old.  She is a kind and friendly woman who works hard so that she can provide a better quality of life for her young son who is 2 years and 8 months old.  Margarita lives in her parents' house as she is in the process of buying her own home.

Margarita's business is renting out a car.  Thanks to the enthusiam that she has always shown in her work and the personal desire she has to improve herself, she has worked in a number of different businesses and, in every one, she managed to save up money.  She used her savings to buy her first vehicle which is now used as a taxi.  Margarita has been in her business for a little over three years and, thanks to this, her income has improved and she has been able to cover some needs that her household face.

What Margarita most enjoys about her work, as a vehicle owner, is that it allows her to travel constantly and enjoy the landscape of her area.  The most difficult part of her work is having to get up early in the morning in order to meet the morning rush hour demand.  She knows that her work is hard but she also knows that, in the shorter term, she will receive rewards from her hard work.  In the future, Margarita hopes to buy another car and to continue making progress.

This is Margarita's seventh loan from MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support as it makes her feel more certain in making progress in her work.  She pledges, once again, to make her repayments on time as she has done with her previous loans.  She is very happy to be a member of her community bank because all of her fellow members are very responsible and supportive of each other.

Margarita will use the loan for 1,500 soles that she has requested to buy some spare parts and to send her vehicle to the mechanics for its six-monthly service.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and pay to have her car serviced

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
This is Vilma. She previously had a PHP 9,000 loan that she used to purchase quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread, and other materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household, and business expenditures. 
She would like to apply for an PHP 11,000 loan to buy additional supplies of raw materials needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 
Vilma hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Nyamsaihan

texts.en: Nyamsaihan is 50 years old and lives with her husband and four children in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Suhbaatar province, Mongolia. Her husband helps with her business; her elder child is a college student; and the rest are all school students. Nyamsaihan repairs roads in her free time. She gained this experience from her parents, and she was repaid for front road work for her neighbor's house. Now she would like to start a road repairing business officially. She just got officially licensed to repair squares and roads. She already hired someone who is skilled for the work and to run her business successfully, she needs some construction raw materials and tools. She's requesting 2,000,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) to purchase sand, gravel and some road-repair tools.

loans.use: To purchase sand, gravel and some road repair tools.

loans.name: Sat

texts.en:
Sat is 44 years old, married, and has been blessed with three now grown-up children, one of whom works in a garment factory in Phnom Penh city. Sat’s main business is to provide construction services to people living in and around Kompong Tom province. He often gets orders from his customers because he has a good business reputation.

To improve his business and make a sustainable income, Sat is taking out a loan in the sum of KHR 4,000,000 to purchase construction supplies and tools used in his current business. This will help him to work out his plan and better his living conditions. For his business goal, he intends to build a strong business and make it become successful.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies and tools used in his current business.

loans.name: Tin

texts.en:
Crop husbandry is the main part of Tin’s family’s income. She is a hard working farmer who plants rice, potatoes, and vegetables for sale. She has a common law relationship with her husband who is her business partner and who is very supportive and always assists her in both indoor and outdoor work. They plan to provide their children opportunities of education and ensure a bright future for them through all their hard work in the field. Tin believes that education is the best way to alleviate poverty.
With the amount she has requested, she would like to pay for labor costs and purchase potato plants for growing. This loan is very useful to improve her business. She said that she will pay her loan back successfully as she obtains a good income from her investment. This is her second loan with HKL.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs and purchase potato plants for growing.

loans.name: Jakhonsho

texts.en: Jakhonsho has been busy with collective farming for more than three years. He has some skills and tries to learn more about it. Jakhonsho grows watermelon, peas, and wheat. Every year he gets a big harvest and sells his food at the local market. Many citizens are happy with Jakhonsho’s work. He has a big and friendly family. His mother and wife help Jakhonsho in business. Jakhonsho is also a careful father. His children love him very much. Jakhonsho’s aim is to buy mineral fertilizers to raise the level of harvesting of his land.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea is 32 years old and has been blessed with three children. She is in the business of cultivating rice and potatoes on a few pieces of land, from which she is able to generate a suitable income for the family. She has a life partner who is involved in the business of selling firewood from a cow-pulled trailer. Her husband often makes a better income than what she does.
At the present, she wants to borrow some funds from HKL in the sum of KHR 3,000,000 to supplement her existing capital to purchase two cows for farming purposes as well as for firewood transportation. In the future, she wants to save some money for the future growth of her business and for her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase two cows for farming purposes as well as for firewood transportation.

loans.name: Chum

texts.en:
Chum is a resident of Baray district, in Kompong Tom province. She is now 45 years old and is responsible for four children, two of whom are already married and have independent lives. Her primary business is rice husbandry. Aside from this, she is also involved in selling fruit for additional household income. She has an old motorcycle that she can use to transport her fruit to the marketplaces. She typically earns around USD 4.00 per day from this business.
She is now asking for a loan from HKL, one of Kiva's partners, to purchase rice seeds and fertilizers and to pay for the labor costs of plowing on her farm. She hopes to obtain this loan, so that she can go on developing her farming business. In the future, Chum wants to own a general store for selling grocery items in her neighborhood.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds and fertilizers and to pay for the labor costs of plowing on her farm.

loans.name: Fozia's Group

texts.en:
Fozia has requested a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who is a rickshaw driver. He drives a rented rickshaw and provides the transportation facilities to the passengers. Because of the rented rickshaw, her husband is bound to drive it for limited hours.   
Fozia is the mother of two sons and three daughters. Two of her children study while her remaining children stay at home. 
With the loan investment, her husband will purchase a new rickshaw of his own, which will help him to drive it for longer hours, which will result in an increase in income and improve the living standard of the family. 
She is hopeful that with the improvement of her husband’s business, she will be able to send her remaining children to school.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce, 26, is a mother; she has one child who is still too young for school who is Joyce’s reason to strive. She’s from Samburu, Kenya. She currently has a well-established clientele in the area and her clothes orders are increasing accordingly. Thanks to her effort and dedication, she has been able to build a little house for herself.

She’s asking for the loan to buy shirts, T-shirts, shorts and other clothes that are in season and that her customers ask her for a lot. She is grateful for the support she’s receiving because everything she does is in order to provide her little child with the best.

loans.use: to buy shirts, T-shirts, shorts and other clothes

loans.name: Mary Cris

texts.en:
Mary Cris is 24 years old, from Sikatuna, Bohol. She is married with two children, ages 1 and 6. While her husband works as a sewer and also a welder, Mary Cris is also into selling prepaid loads. She has been in this business for three years now, earning an average income of 1000 PHP per month. 

She is asking for a loan to buy load and SIM cards to sell. She hopes to improve her business and offer more service in the future for a better profit.

loans.use: to buy electronic load and SIM cards

loans.name: Vaitapu

texts.en: Vaitapu is 50 years old and married with seven children. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as rice, sugar, flour, etc. She has been doing this for two years. Vaitapu needs a loan for consumer items such as sugar, rice and flour. She hopes to use her profits to help her grandchildren's education. She became a member of SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: To buy consumer items such as sugar, rice, flour, etc.

loans.name: Suriya's Group

texts.en:
Suriya has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s fruit selling business. With the loan investment, he will buy fresh seasonal fruits for sale to his clients at a profit. 
He is very good and a professional businessman and works very hard to earn money for the family. She has given birth to two sons and a daughter. Her daughter remains at home while her sons work. 
Suriya is hopeful that her husband will make good use of the loan money and will be successful in improving his business.

loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal fruits for sale

loans.name: Idimo

texts.en: One woman who always works with high spirit is Idimo. She recently started her farming business. Nowadays she tries to do more and to discover a new stage in her career. This woman is a perfect business lady and a good cook. That’s why she raises useful vegetables for herself and for local people. She sells vegetables in the market. Her goods have many customers. Idimo's husband and sons help with her business. Her aim is to buy mineral fertilizers for land on which she works.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Pepe

texts.en:
Pepe is 22 years old and married with no children. She runs a small business selling vegetables in her community and has been doing this for one year.

 Pepe has requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds and chemicals to start a business. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Pepe will help her family for immediate events.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds and chemicals

loans.name: Leobel

texts.en:
Leobel lives in Sikatuna, Bohol. She is 34 years old and is married with two children aged 5 and 12.
She cooks homemade snacks locally known as "puto" (rice cake) and bread. She has been in this business for three years now. 
She would like to ask for a loan to buy rice, sugar, and flour, which are the main ingredients for her business.
She plans to make her business more profitable so that she can send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and flour

loans.name: Mataiumu

texts.en:
Mataiumu is a 44-year-old married woman with seven children.
 
She has a small plantation and grows banana, taro and yams to earn a living. She has been doing this for four years. Mataiumu has requested a loan to buy timber, chemicals, barbed wire and a rake.
 
She has been a member of SPBD since 2008. With her profits, Mataiumu hopes to save her profits for future use, especially for her kids' education.
"

loans.use: to buy timber, chemicals, barbed wire and a rake

loans.name: Kilali

texts.en:
Kilali  is a 21-year-old married woman with no children. She has a small plantation and grows taro and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for one year. Kilali  has requested a loan to purchase new equipment such as a knife, a wheelbarrow and chemicals. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. With her profits, Kilali hopes to help her business as well as her home improvement.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment such as knives, a wheelbarrow, and chemicals

loans.name: Merna

texts.en:
Merna is 36 years old and married with seven children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Merna has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Merna aspires to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Kosim

texts.en: Kosim is a hard-working man. Four years ago, he began his business. He grows agricultural produce such as corn and vegetables. Kosim likes to finish perfectly all beginning deals by himself. From this kind of business Kosim gets enough income because his goods have many consumers. Kosim uses the  money he earns for his family. He has a wife and three children. He wants to improve the level of his life. Kosim loves his family. His aim is to buy mineral fertilizers for a plot of land in which he works.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Latai

texts.en: Latai is 40 years old and single with two children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for one year. Latai has requested a loan to purchase flour, a gas oven, oil and plastic packs. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Latai will help her family, especially her children.

loans.use: to purchase flour, a gas oven, oil and plastic packs…

loans.name: Alijon

texts.en:
Alijon wants to realize all his aims and dreams. He concentrates on being effective in all deals.

Alijon began his activity selling clothing but it didn’t satisfy him and that’s why he decided to change his business. Nowadays, Alijon sells cattle. His father helps him in the business. He sells Alijon’s goods in the local market.  Alijon always tries to find new sources of income. He is smart and clever. Alijon is a careful father. He has a child but he is a widower and is bringing up his child alone. His aim is to buy cattle to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy cattle to expand his business

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justina is 55 years old and works as a masseuse in the community of Sikatuna, Bohol. She is married with two adult children. Justina would like to continue her business by asking for additional capital to buy massage oil, baby oil and alcohol that are necessary for the type of service that she offers. 

In the future, she plans to have a better place to offer to her customers so she can serve them better. Her income will help her and her family in their need for food and payment of household bills like electricity and water.

loans.use: to buy massage oil, baby oil and alcohol

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en:
Shirly is 42 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Shirly is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Shirly has been farming rice for five years and also earns additional income from food vending. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Yenyfer Abigail

texts.es:
Jenyfer tiene 25 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene un hijo, vive con sus abuelos y su hijo en una aldea del Municipio de Olanchito, Yoro. 
Yenyfer  desde hace 2 años se dedica al negocio de venta de mercadería como Ropa, carteras y calzado vende la mercadería de manera ambulante. Actualmente ella esta estudiando enfermería y manifiesta que por eso se motivo a tener su propio negocio para sacar los ingresos que le ayudaran a solventar los gastos del Hogar y de sus estudios. Dice que hasta el momento le ha ido bien y sus ventas son rentables.
Ella esta solicitando un préstamo a ODEF  de 10,000 lempiras para comprar mas mercadería como sandalias, blusas, camisas y calzado para tener producto que ofrecer a los clientes y mejorar sus ingresos.
Su meta es lograr tener su propio local donde pueda vender su mercadería y tener el capital necesario para seguir pagando sus estudios.
texts.en:
Yenyfer is 25 years old and a single mother with one child. She lives with her grandparents and her son in a neighborhood in the town of Olanchito, Yoro.

For the past two years, Yenyfer has been selling clothes, wallets, and shoes as a street vendor. She is currently studying to become a nurse. For this reason, having her own business allows her to generate income to cover the household expenses and pay for her studies. She says that she is doing well at the moment and that her sales are profitable.

Yenyfer is requesting a loan of 10,000 HNL from ODEF in order to buy more merchandise such as sandals, blouses, shirts, and shoes so that she can have products to offer to her customers and improve her earnings. Her goals are to have her own shop where she can sell her merchandise and to have the necessary capital to continue paying for her studies.

loans.use: to buy sandals, blouses, shirts, and shoes.

loans.name: Odil

texts.en: Odil is a master of driving. His car is as quick as the running horse. He knows his deal (business) perfectly because Odil has worked in this sphere for more than 12 years. He drives from Dushanbe to Jilkurgon. Odil’s clients are glad for his business. He is married and has four children. He wants to buy all the things that his children need. Odil must expand his business to improve the level of his life. His aim is to buy spare parts to repair his car.

loans.use: To buy spare parts to repair his car

loans.name: Kanga

texts.en:
Kanga, 25, is a mother who has five children between nine and eleven years old, all of whom attend school. She’s from Samburu, Kenya. She currently has a well-established clientele in the zone and her retail shop has been operational for the past three years. Thanks to her effort and dedication, she has been able to build a house for herself.

She’s asking for the loan to buy bales of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and household goods. She is grateful for the support she’s receiving because everything she does is in order to provide her little children with the best.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and household items.

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
This is Vicky, 39, resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Randy, a security guard, and mother of one child who is currently in elementary (school) level. By the grace of God, Vicky has managed to support her child's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to be able to send her child all the way through college. For most Filipino parents like Vicky, as she herself has been a college undergraduate, believe that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Vicky maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fullerlife, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing in to receive as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She also sells snack food for additional income. She earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands.
  
Vicky dreams to be able to give her child a high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies of products and merchandise needed in her business

loans.name: Ruta

texts.en: Ruta is 50 years old and married with one kid. She makes and sells baskets, fans, etc to earn a living and has been doing this for one year. Ruta has requested a loan to purchase materials for the business. She plans to use her profits to start a business hopefully to improve her home. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to purchase materials and pandana leaves

loans.name: Elizabeth Noemi

texts.es:
Elizabeth, es comerciante de ropa, vive con su esposo y un hijo, el negocio de ella lo inicio por iniciativa propia, trabaja de forma ambulante, no tiene un horario establecido ya que depende de la zona que le toca recorrer.

Ella está solicitando un préstamo pues tiene la iniciativa de fortalecer el negocio comprandose una variedad de ropa nueva para poder vender, blusas, faldas, ropa interior, camisas para ambos sexos, esto le permitirá tener un inventario más surtido y poder satisfacer a la clientela.

La aspiración de Elizabeth es desarrollar un negocio más competente, atender mejor a la clientela y poder ayudar a su esposo y a su hijo con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a clothing vendor who lives with her spouse and son.  Her business is one she started herself and she works as a peddler, so she doesn't have an established daily schedule since it depends on the area that she is going through.

She is asking for a loan because she is taking initiative to strengthen her business by buying a variety of new clothing to sell, blouses, skirts, underwear, unisex shirts, since this will allow her to have a wider selection of inventory and be able to satisfy her customers.

Elizabeth's aspiration is to develop a more complete business, to better serve her customers, and to be able to help her husband and child with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, underwear, and unisex shirts.

loans.name: Talita

texts.en: Talita is 30 years old and married with 4 children. She runs a small business selling scones, buns and other items in her community and has been doing this for 4 years. Talita has requested a loan to buy a new oven. She joined SPBD 3 years ago to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Talita will expand her business .

loans.use: to buy a new oven

loans.name: Teofreda

texts.en:
Teofreda is 42 years old. She is from Sikatuna, Bohol. Teofreda is married with two children who are still dependents. She is currently engaged in making furniture as her source of livelihood. Her business started 3 years ago. 

Teofreda would like to accommodate more orders and is asking for a loan to buy hardwood and plywood. She is aiming on having a bigger business so she could provide better for her family, especially her children's education and family daily consumption.

loans.use: to buy hardwood and plywood

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is married with 3 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Vilma is 46 years old and has 2 children who are in school.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Vilma requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell.

She has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, Vilma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en:
Adelfa is 62 years old and single. She works hard to provide for her family. 

Adelfa runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from selling vegetables.

She requested a 22000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell. Adelfa has borrowed and paid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. Adelfa aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Muhiddin

texts.en:
Muhiddin is a married man with three children he supports. He is a business man who knows his trade well. 

For 10 years, Muhiddin has tended livestock as his source of income. Muhiddin also works the land; he grows rice and sells the harvest in the local market. 

Muhiddin wants to develop his business, which is why he's taken debt from IMON International. His goal is to buy livestock in order to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Cosme Vinicio

texts.es:
San Miguel de los Bancos, o simplemente Los Bancos, es un cantón de la provincia de Pichincha en Ecuador. El clima del cantón es subtropical, debido a su altitud media-alta, en comparación con el clima de las zonas altas de la provincia entre las cordilleras Occidental y Central.  El cantón está dividido en dos parroquias: la parroquia urbana de San Miguel de los Bancos y la parroquia rural de Mindo. 
Al igual que con otros cantones de la provincia de Pichincha, la economía de los Bancos es principalmente agrícola, basado sobre todo en el ganado de sensibilización. Recientemente, ha habido un crecimiento considerable en el turismo ecológico, sobre todo en Mindo. 
En este hermoso cantón encontramos a Vinicio, un emprendedor de 41 años que ha hecho del campo su hogar y de la naturaleza su vida. Oriundo de Loja, Vinicio hace poco más de 15 años decidió ir a “Los Bancos” para comenzar su negocio de ganado. Él vive sólo tiene un hijo de 18 años que ya no vive con él. Vinicio trabaja en su propiedad alrededor de 12 horas diarias cuidando su ganado y su propiedad
En su tiempo libre Vinicio hace deporte para mantenerse sano, le gusta recorrer los alrededores y admirar la belleza del ecosistema y la vegetación a su alrededor. Él acude a Fundación Alternativa, institución encargada de los fondos que Kiva otorga a muchos emprendedores, con el objetivo de aumentar las cabezas de ganado en su propiedad y así aumentar su producción agrícola.
texts.en:
San Miguel de los Bancos (also known as ‘Los Bancos’) is a canton in the province of Pichincha in Ecuador.  The climate in the canton is subtropical due to its moderately high altitude, in contrast to the climate of the province’s highlands between the Western and Central Cordilleras.  The canton is divided into two parishes: the urban parish of San Miguel de los Bancos and the rural parish of Mindo.  As in the other cantons in Pichincha province, the economy of Los Bancos is mainly agricultural, and is mostly based on raising livestock.  However, there has recently been considerable growth in ecotourism, especially in Mindo.

Vinicio is a resident of this beautiful canton.  He is a 41-year-old entrepreneur who has spent his life working in the field and feels very much at home there.  Vinicio is a native of Loja, but he decided to come to Los Bancos a little over 15 years ago to start his cattle business.  He lives alone, and has an 18-year-old son who no longer lives with him.  Vinicio works on his land about 12 hours a day caring for his cattle and maintaining his property.  In his free time he enjoys playing sports to stay healthy; he also enjoys going out in the surrounding area and admiring the beauty of the ecosystem and the vegetation there.  Vinicio is requesting a loan from Fundación Alternativa, an institution that manages funds from Kiva and provides them to local entrepreneurs.  Vinicio’s goal is to increase the number of cattle he has on his property and thus increase his agricultural production.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle to raise.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María tiene 26 años, es una mujer joven, amable y muy trabajadora. Es madre de un niño de 6 años, su pareja es Julio, de 28 años, el padre de su hijo. Viven en su casa propia, construida con apoyo económico de sus familiares, donde comparte con su pareja la alegría de vivir juntos y su continuo esfuerzo por tener una mejor calidad de vida.

Ella se dedica a la venta de zapatos y ropa, de manera quincenal o mensual, dependiendo de la demanda. Para obtener su mercadería viaja a otra ciudad en autobús por más de 20 horas, luego realiza el mismo viaje de retorno trayendo gran cantidad de prendas, los diseños que trae son modelos de temporada, exclusivos y de buena calidad, es por eso que logra venderlos en todos en poco tiempo. La venta de zapatos la realiza de forma ambulatoria, recorriendo, todos los días, las principales calles de la ciudad. Desde que comenzó en este negocio le ha ido muy bien gracias a su carisma y a la calidad de cada uno de los artículos que vende.
Lo que más le gusta de su actividad es vender, es feliz cuando toda su mercadería se agota. Lleva más de 8 años realizando esta labor y considera que lo más difícil es transportar los zapatos, ya que las cajas que trae son muy pesadas y se agita mucho por el esfuerzo que hace. Sin embargo, sigue adelante y en un futuro cercano espera tener una tienda en la que pueda vender todo tipo de prendas y calzado, y así continuar trabajando en lo que considera que es su pasión.

Este es su crédito número 10 con MFP, por tanto agradece a quienes lo hacen posible, para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, está muy comprometida, una vez más, a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas como lo hizo anteriormente. Y está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son muy buenos, amables y solidarios.

Con el monto solicitado (S/. 2800) desea incrementar la variedad de su mercadería, comprando mayor cantidad de zapatos, ropa y otros artículos de uso personal.
texts.en:
María is 26 years old; she is a young woman who is friendly and very hardworking.  She is the mother of one child, who is six years old, and her partner is Julio, a 28 year old, who is the father of her son.  They live in their own home, constructed with the financial support of their family, where she shares the happiness of living together with her partner and their ongoing struggle to have a better quality of life.

She works as a saleswoman of shoes and clothing on a biweekly or monthly basis, depending upon the level of demand.  To obtain her merchandise, she travels to another city on a bus trip lasting over 20 hours, and then makes the same return trip carrying a great quantity of items.  The designs she carries are the latest fashions, exclusive, and of good quality; this is why she is able to achieve the sales of all her clothing in such a short time.  The shoe sales are made on foot, traveling each day through the major streets of the city.  Ever since she began her business, it has gone very well thanks to her charisma and the quality of each of the articles that she sells.

What she likes best about her business is making a sale, and she's happy when her merchandise is all sold.  She has spent more than 8 years in this line of work, and she thinks the most difficult part is carrying the shoes because the boxes she must carry are quite heavy and it is worrisome how much strength it takes.  However, she continues moving forward, and in the near future, she hopes to have a shop in which she will be able to sell all kinds of garments and footwear, and she will continue to work in the field which she considers to be her passion.

This is her tenth credit with MFP, for which she gives thanks to all those who make it possible for her to continue with her goals.  She is very committed, once again, to complete her payments on time as she has done in the past.  She is very happy to be a part of her community bank, because the members are very good, friendly, and in supportive.

With the amount she is asking (S/. 2800), she hopes to augment her variety of merchandise, buying a greater quantity of shoes, clothing, and other personal items.

loans.use: to increase the variety of her merchandise (shoes, clothing, and other personal items).

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de ceviche que es un plato a base de pescado con limon,ella tiene un local donde trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia quiere salir adelante,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de ceviche.La socia solicita el credito para comprar limon,pescados y platos para que prepare los ceviches.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member continues to manage a business of selling "ceviche", a dish that consists of fish marinated in citrus juice. She has a location where she works from 9am to 6pm. Through this business, she is able to stay ahead. Her dream is to expand her business of selling "ceviche". The member is requesting a loan in order to buy Peruvian lemons, fish, and plates for preparing this dish.

She is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy Peruvian lemons, fish, and plates.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORICHUSPA”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Julia; continua dedicandose a la venta de autopartes de auto,la socia viaja hasta la ciudad de Lima y Puno para comprar su mercaderia,ella tiene su pequeña tienda donde vende toda su mercaderia a sus clientes que le solicitan,a la vez la socia se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa ,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el prestamo para la compra de autopartes para su negocio como faros.

La socia se siente agradecida por el prestamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This businesswoman belongs to the community bank “QORICHUSPA.”  This bank is located in the district of Huanchac in the province and department of Cusco.

Julia continues to engage in the sale of autoparts for cars.  She travels to the city of Lima and Puno to buy her merchandise.  She has her own small shop where she sells all of her merchandise to the customers who ask for them.  At the same time, she is also in the business of buying and sales of clothing.  She is a responsible and earnest person and it is in these ways that this woman helps her family to move forward.

She is asking for the loan in order to buy autoparts for her business, like headlights.

She feels very thankful for the loan she has been granted and promises to comply with the established payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy autoparts for her business, like headlights.

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.en: Elisabeth is a 28-year-old woman who is married with three children. She runs a business printing fabrics to sell to the people in her community. She has two years of experience with this business. Elisabeth has requested a loan to purchase new materials, paint and brushes. She plans to use her profits to help her kids. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics, painting materials, etc.

loans.name: Norma Eulogia

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de compra y venta de materiales educativos como libros,cuentos lapices entre otros materiales educativos,la socia trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere tener un local donde pueda vender los materiales educativos.La socia solicita el credito para comprar libros,cuentos y lapízes al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The businesswoman continues to be in sales of educational materials, such as books, stories, and pencils among other educational items.  She works from 9:00am until 6:00pm, and with this business she is able to help her children get ahead.  The woman would like to have a shop in which she would be able to sell her school supplies.  She is asking for this loan in order to buy books, stories, and pencils at wholesale prices.

The businesswoman is happy about her loan and promises to pay her loan payments on time.

loans.use: to buy books, stories, and pencils at wholesale.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
This is Evelyn, She previously took an 8,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a 10,000 PHP loan to buy more merchandise items and products to increase her product inventory. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Evelyn dreams of sending her children all the way through college. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en: Rosalina is a 28-year-old woman who is married with four children. She runs a business printing clothes in her community. She has two years of experience with this business. Rosalina has requested a loan to purchase new materials for the business. She plans to use her profits to extend the business and save for her kids' education. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, paints and brushes

loans.name: Nilda Zoraida

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORICHUSPA”; La socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco, del departamento de Cusco.
	
La  socia es la Sra. Nilda; la socia continua dedicandose a la costureria ella confecciona diferentes tipos de trabajos como casacas,buzos y trajes de nuestra region,la socia tiene su pequeño taller en su domicilio,a la vez la socia es profesora de manualidades ,la socia es una persona responsable y carismatica,siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales como telas y cierres.

La socia agradece el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
The businesswoman is a part of the community bank “QORICHUSPA.”  She lives in the district of Huanchac in the province of Cusco, part of the department of Cusco.
	
She is Mrs. Nilda, and she continues to be in business as a seamstress.  She makes different kinds of works like jackets, sweatshirts, and traditional costumes of the region.  The woman has a small workshop in her home, and at the same time, she is a teacher of handicrafts.  She is a responsible and charismatic person, who uses this business to move her family forward.

She is asking for this loan to buy materials like fabrics and fasteners.

She is thankful for the promised loan and promises to pay off her loan at the stipulated times.

loans.use: to buy materials like fabrics and fasteners.

loans.name: Vanesa

texts.es:
Vanesa tiene 33 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora. Vive en su casa propia desde hace 8 años, junto a su esposo Henry, de 36 años, y sus dos queridos hijos: Rosa de 15 y Jorge de 3 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida.

Ella es una mujer a quien le gusta mucho trabajar y siente gran afición por la venta de comida regional; esta labor la ha vino realizando hasta hace un año atrás, pero por motivos de enfermedad y prescripción médica tuvo que dejarlo. Sin embargo, ahora nos sorprende con otro negocio que ha establecido en la vereda de su casa. Empezó a vender abarrotes, verduras, plátanos, carnes y otros productos de primera necesidad; adicionalmente vende gaseosas, hielo y helados, con los que también genera el dinero necesario para la alimentación y el pago de algunos gastos propios del día; mientras que su esposo aporta el dinero que lo obtiene trabajando como chofer de un motocarro.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que no le demanda mucho esfuerzo y puede mantenerse en reposo, manteniendo controlada su salud, y le agrada el ritmo con el que va creciendo su puesto de abarrotes. Con el tiempo, espera juntar el dinero necesario para poner una bodega que le permita mantener su clientela y al mismo tiempo incrementar la cantidad y variedad de los artículos que vende actualmente.

Este es el crédito número 6 con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá más segura de avanzar con su trabajo. Asimismo, se compromete, una vez más, a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas, como lo hizo anteriormente. Y está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son muy responsables y solidarios.

Con el monto solicitado (S/. 3500) comprará algunos comestibles con los que surtirá su puesto de ventas, así como también algunas bebidas gaseosas y helados.
texts.en:
Vanesa is 33 years old, and is a friendly and hardworking woman.  She has lived in her own house for the past 8 years along with her husband Henry, aged 36, and her two beloved children: Rosa, age 15, and Jorge, who is 3 years old, to whom she hopes to give a better quality of life.

She is a woman who really likes to work and she feels a great affection for the sales of regional food dishes; this is a work she has been doing for the past year, but for reasons of sickness and a medical prescription, she had to stop doing so.  However, she has been surprisingly able to start another business in her home village.  She began selling groceries, vegetables, plantains, meats, and other staples.  Additionally, she sells sodas, ice, and ice creams, with which she is also able to make money for food and to pay some of her own daily expenses; while her spouse also brings in money working as a rickshaw driver.

What she most likes about her job is that it does not demand much effort and that she can remain at in one place, maintaining her health, and she likes the pace at which her grocery stall business is growing. Over time, she hopes to get the money together to be able to have a warehouse that would allow her to maintain her current customer base and at the same time to increase the quantity and variety of goods from what she currently sells.

This is her sixth credit with MFP, and she is very happy to know that she has a financial support, since this makes her feel more secure in advancing her business prospects.  As with the previous loans, she promises again to be punctual in her payments, just as she has done before.  She is very pleased to be a part of the community bank and thinks all the members are very responsible and supportive.

With the amount asked for (S/. 3500) she will buy more food items with which to stock her food stall, like some types of sodas and ice cream.

loans.use: to buy food items with which to supply her food stall.

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en:
Adelfa is 67 years old and married with 12 children.

Adelfa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 16,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Adelfa has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from her rice retail business.

Adelfa aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Roy Luis

texts.es:
Roy es un hombre de 39 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con su pareja, él es un hombre luchador, trabajador y entusiasta que dedica todos sus esfuerzos para salir adelante y superarse en la vida; lamentablemente por la necesidad de tener que trabajar desde muy joven, no pudo estudiar la carrera de Enfermería que tanto quería, pero sueña con poder hacerlo algún día; en sus ratos libres le gusta salir a pasear con su pareja y amigos por las calurosas y acogedoras calles de la ciudad y en algunas ocasiones gustan de comer un riquísimo “Lomo Saltado”.
Por iniciativa propia y gracias al apoyo de su pareja, Roy puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de venta de repuestos para vehículos menores; asimismo, vende cerveza al por mayor y menor, él dedica a su negocio un aproximado de 12 horas diarias, en las cuales puede atender un promedio de 8 clientes, Roy cree que su negocio marcha bien debido a la calidad, buenos precios y trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Roy se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de cajas de aceites para autos, así como repuestos en general; de esta manera Roy podrá tener mejor abastecido su negocio y podrá incrementar sus ventas, así como sus ingresos económicos y con ellos poco a poco espera poder convertir su pequeño negocio en un tienda más grande de venta de repuestos en general.
texts.en:
Roy is 39 years old.  He lives in the city of Pucallpa with his partner. He is a hardworking and enthusiastic man who dedicates all of his efforts to getting ahead and succeeding in life. Unfortunately, due to the necessity of having to work since very young, he was not able to study the profession of nursing, which he greatly wanted to do, however he dreams of still being able to do so one day.  In his spare time he likes strolling through the warm and welcoming streets of the city with his partner and friends and occasionally enjoys eating the delicious “Lomo saltado.”

On his own initiative and thanks to his partner’s support, Roy started his small business selling spare parts for small vehicles. In addition he sells beer, both wholesale and retail. He works in his business approximately 12 hours daily during which he takes care of an average of 8 customers. Roy believes that his business is doing well due to the quality, good prices and friendly service that he provides his customers.

Roy is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their help, he was able to buy cases of automobile oil as well as parts in general. In this way he will be able to have his business well stocked and increase sales and income. Thus he hopes to turn his small business, little by little, into a larger shop selling spare parts in general.

loans.use: to buy cases of car oil as well as spare parts in general.

loans.name: Moises

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al trabajo como albañil,el es maestro de construccion civil,el realiza trabajos como casas,refacciones y acabados de casas,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negcoio el socio saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño del socio es mejorar cada vez en su trabajo.El socio solicita el credito para comprar materiales de construccion como cemento,arena,clavos y herramientas.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Moises continues working as a construction worker. He is a master of civil construction and carries out projects such as houses, renovations and house finishings. He works from 8.00 a.m. to 6.00 p.m. in this business on average. Moises is helping is kids to move towards a better future. His dream is to keep improving in his work. He is asking for a loan to buy construction materials such as cement, sand, nails and tools. 

He is happy to receive the loan and promises to make the repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as cement, sand, nails and tools.

loans.name: Deodelyn

texts.en:
Deodelyn is 42 years old and married with 6 children who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Deodelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional items to sell.

Deodelyn has been in this business for 12 years and sells a variety of items such as sardines, sugar, milk, soap and shampoo.

In the future, Deodelyn would like to save enough money so that she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is forty-nine years old and has five children. She is married and has three children who are in school.

Editha is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Editha has been raising pigs for two years now and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Editha would like to save enough money so that she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Liberty

texts.en:
Liberty is married with 3 children. She is 52 years old and lives in Butuay, Jimenez in the province of Misamis Occidental.

Liberty operates a general store to earn a living and has had this business for 30 years. She has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store.

Liberty has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, she hopes to engage in other types of business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 62 years old and married with five children.  She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Editha has borrowed and paid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from her rice retailer business.  Editha aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Eveyln

texts.en:
Eveyln is 52 years old and married with one child.

Eveyln works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 22,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Eveyln has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from dressmaking.

Eveyln aspires to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es:
Zoila tiene 50 años, es una mujer alegre, amable y muy trabajadora. Vive con Jorge, de 52 años, quien es su pareja hace 35 años. Tienen cuatro hijos, de los cuales dos de ellos son menores de edad, tienen 17 y 10 años, están en etapa escolar y dependen aun de lo que Zoila y Jorge. Viven en su casa propia, la que consiguieron con mucho esfuerzo y toda la familia pone mucho empeño para seguir adelante. 

Su negocio es la venta de comida, ella misma se encarga de la preparación de sabrosos potajes regionales, la clientela es atraída a su puesto por el inigualable aroma y el agradable sabor de sus comidas. Vende en la vereda de su casa, que está ubicada en un sector muy concurrido, aunque solo realiza este trabajo por las noches, ha visto que le genera buenos ingresos económicos. Se inició en este rubro hace 40 años, ya que desde muy niña ayudaba en la cocina y participaba en la preparación de los alimentos al lado de su madre, oficio que también ella realizaba de manera ambulatoria. Este negocio le ha dado el dinero necesario para alimentar a sus hijas y pagarles sus estudios, pero siente que más adelante va a tener más gastos y el dinero le va a faltar, por eso desea tener un restaurante en su casa, donde pueda vender con mayor comodidad. Por otra parte, durante el día, quiere incursionar en la venta de repuestos de moto, ya que ha visto por el trabajo que realizan sus hijos mayores que esta actividad también genera buenas ganancias; con ambos trabajos busca consolidar sus ingresos económicos. Zoila disfruta mucho de su actividad, más aún adora ver a sus comensales contentos, pues le agrada conversar con sus clientes mientras disfrutan de sus platillos. Algunas veces se le hace muy difícil atender a todas las personas que concurren a su puesto, a pesar de eso no decae en su afán de salir adelante.

Este es su crédito número 6 con MFP, por tanto agradece la oportunidad y confianza que ponen en ella. Por otro lado, se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual. Y le agrada ser parte del banco comunal al que pertenece, ya que ha visto que sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias.

Con el monto solicitado (S/. 3500) comprará ingredientes y algunos insumos que necesita para continuar con la preparación de sus comidas. Así también, invertirá en materiales de construcción para acondicionar un pequeño local para la atención de sus clientes. Y destinará cierta cantidad en la compra de repuestos de motocarros.
texts.en:
Zoila is 50 years old. She is a happy, friendly and hard-working woman. She lives with Jorge who is 50 years old and who has been her partner for 35 years. They have four children of whom two are minors, 17 and 10 years old. They are of school-age and remain dependent on Zoila and Jorge. They live in their own house, which they obtained with a lot of hard work, and their family is determined to get ahead. 

He business is food sales. She herself is in charge of preparing delicious regional stews. Her customers are attracted to her stall because of the unbeatable aroma and delicious flavour of her foods. She sells on the sidewalk in front of her house, which is located in a very busy area, although she only carries out this work at night. She has seen that she makes a good income from this business. 

She started working like this 40 years ago, as since she was a young girl she helped in the kitchen and with the preparation of food at her mother’s side, something she also did as a mobile-vendor. This business has given her to money necessary to feed her girls and pay their studies. However she feels that further down the track she will have more expenses and she will not have enough money to cover them. For this reason she wants to start a restaurant in her house, where she can sell more comfortably.
 
On the other hand, during the day she wants to start selling spare motorcycle parts, since she has seen from the work her older children carry out that this generates a good income. With both business she hopes to consolidate her income. 

Zoila enjoys this work very much, and loves even more to see her diners happy, since she she likes to chat with her clients whilst they enjoy her dishes. Sometimes she finds it difficult to serve all the people who attend her stall. Despite this she does not falter in her eagerness to get ahead. 

This is her sixth credit with MFP, and for this reason she is thankful for the opportunity and confidence it inspires in her. On the otherhand she promises to make repayments punctually. She is grateful to be part of the communal bank of which she is a member, since she has seen that its members are responsible and there is solidarity amongst them. With the amount she is asking for (S/.3500) she will buy ingredients and some supplies she needs to continue with the preparation of her foods. She will also invest in some construction materials to air-condition a small restaurant-premises for the service of her clients. She will also invest part of the sum in the purchase of spare motorcycle parts.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and some supplies for food preparation and the construction of a restaurant premises for her business.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is married with six children. Regina is 62 years old and lives in Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.

Regina sells snacks to earn a living and has had this business for 18 years. She has requested a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to purchase more raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

Regina has been a member of PMPC for 10 years. In the future, Regina hopes to engage in another type of business.

loans.use: to purchase more raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

loans.name: Flordelina

texts.en:
Flordelina is 57 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for the family.

Flordelina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 29,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell.

Flordelina has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, sugar, canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc.

In the future, Flordelina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn lives in Poblacion 2, Sikatuna, Bohol.  She is married with four children. While her husband is a carpenter, she also operates a furniture-making business as well as a sari-sari store. 

Evelyn has requested this loan to buy hardwood, plywood, and grocery items for her sari-sari store. The profit will be for her children's school fees and her family's daily consumption. In the future, she would like to save enough so she can renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy hardwood, plywood, and grocery items.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 40 years old and married with three children, two who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.  Emily runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell.  She has been in this business for 25 years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, canned goods, soap, etc. 

In the future, Emily would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Sri Cendana Group

texts.en:
The Sri Cendana group is requesting a loan in the same amount as their last loan, and the members are also requesting the same amount. One member could not attend the meeting because of illness and another is represented by her mother in the photograph.

Ni Ketut will use this loan to buy two superior piglets for 800,000 Indonesian rupiahs and will use the rest to buy feed. She decided to choose the superior quality piglets because of the high price at which she can sell them later and because it is easier to find a big buyer. She hopes for her business to run smoothly and give her enough profit to support her economic needs, especially for her children's education. Ni Ketut will also ask for an increased loan amount for her next loan period.

loans.use: to buy two superior piglets.

loans.name: Monzer

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. Monzer is 49 years old, married, and has five children.  He has a small shop for electrical goods. He established his business in 2008. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and is well-known in the surrounding areas.

Monzer is requesting a loan of $2,400 to renew and redecorate his shop. His aim is to gain more profits, which will offer a better standard of life for the whole family.

loans.use: to renew and redecorate his shop.

loans.name: Salasala Group

texts.en:
Abubakari, who is in his early thirties, is married with three children. Two of them go to school and one is still young. Abubakari has had a business of selling spare parts for motorcycles and motorbikes since 2005. He works from 7 a.m. to 6:30 p.m. daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Abubakari's fifteenth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.
