He used the previous loans to rent a shop in which to sell his spare parts, buy a motorcycle, TV set and radio, restock the missing items in his shop, start building his house, and pay his household expenses. He has paid back all his loans successfully. Abubakari wants a loan to buy more motorbike and motorcycle spare parts to resell. His dream is to one day be able to finish building his house.

Abubakari will share this loan with his loan group "Salasala" that has a total of fifteen members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more motorcycle and motorbike spare parts to resell.

loans.name: Ernie

texts.en:
Ernie is forty years old, married and has three children, all of whom are in school.

Ernie is in the agricultural business of buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. He has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to raise and sell.

Ernie has been buying and selling livestock for six years now and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain his business.

In the future, Ernie would like to save enough money so that he could afford to send his children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to raise and sell.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is a 25-year-old woman from Barangay Poblacion 2, Sikatuna, Bohol. She is married with two young children, ages one and two years. To earn an income in order to support her family, Salome operates a sari-sari store, or variety store. She has been in this business for two years now, earning 1,500 PHP per month for her family. Salome is asking for a loan to buy soft drinks, canned goods, noodles and seasonings.

Salome is determined to see her children finish their education when they grow older, the reason for which she is working hard for their future now. The income earned will help Salome to meet her family's daily needs like food, milk and nappies for her children.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, canned goods, noodles and seasonings.

loans.name: Gay

texts.en:
Gay works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Gay has requested a loan of 29,500 PHP through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her business.

Gay has been in this business for six years now.

In the future, Gay would like to save enough money so that she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Elizabeth's Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth is married with seven children. She is 63 years old and lives in Tabo-o, Jimenez, in the province of Misamis Occidental.

Elizabeth sells fish to earn a living and has had this business for twenty years. She has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase more fish to sell.

Elizabeth has been a member of PMPC for eight years. In the future, she hopes to engage in other types of business. Elizabeth is the leader of a two-person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has her own business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business selling oysters in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy more oysters to sell in her food stall.

Elsie has been in this business for 11 years.  In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more oysters to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Adel

texts.en:
Adel, aged 44, is from Iraq. He is married and lives with seven family members.

Adel is a blacksmith: in 2003, he opened his own workshop making doors and windows. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. Adel has a good reputation and is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a loan of $2400 in order to purchase an electrical generator. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase an electrical generator

loans.name: Jonaven Rose

texts.en:
Jonaven Rose is 36 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for her family. Jonaven Rose runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her store.

She has been in this business for nine years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, shampoo, etc. In the future, Jonaven Rose would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her child to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 63 years old and has seven children, all of whom still attend school. She operates a posho mill machine that she uses for grinding maize. 

Rose has been in this business for 11 years. She provides her customers with excellent service and also helps her family. Rose's goals are to continue working and to become a successful micro-entrepreneur. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy maize for sale. Rose is grateful for the assistance, which will allow her to grow in her enterprise and quickly accomplish the goals she has set for herself as an entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy maize for sale.

loans.name: Anyar Sari 1 Group

texts.en:
The Anyar Sari 1 group is made up of 11 women who are neighbors in the same village in Sangketan, in the middle area of Bali.  The group is seeking a loan of 38,5M IDR, and each member will receive 3,5M IDR.  The group was formed from these women’s common interest in raising pigs to supplement family income and from their interest in education on best practices for pig raising.  This is their second loan with MUK.

Ni Wayan is the head of the group. Following the first loan, she will now use this loan to buy four more piglets. Ni Wayan would like to help support her family with her pig raising business. She plans to sell the piglets after six months for use as fattening pigs.  With the increase in household income, she hopes to be able to renovate her house. 

For the photo, two members couldn't attend the meeting because they had a religious ceremony at the the temple and one member was represented by her husband because she was sick.

loans.use: to buy four more piglets

loans.name: Noem

texts.en:
Noem is a 50-year-old married woman, who has been living in a small village, a suburban area of Phnom Penh city. She is in a common law relationship with her husband, who is a security guard working for a private company in the city. Noem owns a few pieces of land, on which she grows rice and vegetables two seasons of the year. She has been in this business for almost 19 years. She has eight children, four of whom are married, and the other four are single, living with her under the same roof.

In order to renovate her house and make it more comfortable, Noem decided to take out a loan of USD800 to buy the construction materials needed for fixing her house and building a toilet. This loan will change her living conditions and provide her family with happiness. Noem told us that she will strive to work harder to create more opportunities for the future education of her children.

loans.use: to buy the construction materials needed for fixing her house and building a toilet.

loans.name: Maxima

texts.en:
Maxima is 51 years old, married with three adult children. For four years now, she has been operating a sari-sari (general) store business in the the town of Sikatuna, Bohol.  

Maxima is asking for a loan to buy items like noodles, cooking oil, eggs, toiletries and seasonings to sell. An increase in her income will enable her to buy healthy food for her family and also to pay basic household bills like electricity and water. 

In the future, she plans to make consistent improvements to her store so it will be more attractive to her customers.

loans.use: to buy items like noodles, cooking oil, eggs, toiletries and seasonings to sell.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fried chicken food stall business in the Philippines. Jessica has requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for the fried chicken that she sells to customers.

Jessica has been in this business for 17 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for the fried chicken that she sells to customers.

loans.name: Actable The Best Group

texts.en:
Sara, who is in her late 40s, is married with six children, all of whom go to school although one is still small. She has been selling fried chicken for seven years now. She works from 7.00pm to 10.00pm daily (three hours only in the evenings) and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Sara's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania which she wants to use to buy more chicken and a small bucket of cooking oil. Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house.

Sara will share this loan with her loan group, "Actable The Best," which has a total of 18 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more chicken and a small bucket of cooking oil.

loans.name: Yedi

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de servicio de taxi,el socio trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio el socio quiere salir adelante,el sueño del socio es mejorar en su negocio de servicio de taxi.El socio solicita el credito para comprar llantas para su carro.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Yedi keeps on providing his taxi service, working form 6 am to 10 pm. He hopes to progress in life thanks to his activity, and his dream is to improve his taxi service. He is requesting a loan to buy tyres for his vehicle.

He is happy about the loan and he commits to complying with the repayments of his dues.

loans.use: To buy tyres for his vehicle.

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
Vicky is 55 years old and married with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Vicky has a food production business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Vicky has been in this business for 37 years.  In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is 42 years old and has eight children. She has operated a retail shop business (a food stall) for the past three years. In addition, she operates a motorcycle transport business which provides her other source of income. Asha sells to her neighbours and passersby. She provides her customers with excellent service and also helps her family. 

Asha's goals are to continue working and to become a successful micro-entrepreneur. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy supplies for her food stall, such as wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and rice. Asha is grateful for the assistance, which will allow her to grow in her enterprise and quickly accomplish the goals she has set for herself as an entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her food stall, such as wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and rice.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is from Iraq. He is 52 years old, married and has three children.

Mohamad has owned an upholstery workshop since 2004. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $2000 loan in order to increase his upholstery workshop inventory. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to increase his upholstery workshop inventory

loans.name: Scholastica

texts.en:
Scholastica is 36 years old and has five children, all of whom still attend school. She operates a retail shop, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby.  She has been in this business for three years.  She provides her customers with excellent service and also helps her family. 

Scholastica's goals are to continue working and to become a successful micro-entrepreneur.  The loan she is requesting will be used to buy bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and sugar. Scholastica is grateful for the assistance, which will allow her to grow in her enterprise and quickly accomplish the goals she has set for herself as an entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and sugar.

loans.name: Dukundumurimo B /gr Group

texts.fr:
Liberathe fait partie du groupe Dukundumurimo B. Le nom du groupe signifie «Aime le travail». Elle a 42 ans, elle est marie avec 6 enfants de 3 ans à 21 ans, dont 3 scolarises. Son niveau d’éducation est de 8 ans de primaire.

Liberathe est agriculteur des pommes terre. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Elle va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter 200kgs des semences des pommes de terre, 40 kgs des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre.

Pour faire croitre son agriculture, elle planifie d’acheter des champs pour agrandir l’étendu de son agriculture et demander d’autres prêts. Dans les prochaines années, elle voudrait être le grand distributeur des pommes des terres dans sa région. Avec les profits, elle prévoit de continuer à payer les frais scolaire pour ses enfants et construire une maison pour sa famille.
texts.en:
Liberathe is a member of the Dukundumurimo B group. The group’s name means "Love work". Liberathe is 42 years old and married. She has 6 children aged from three to 21 years, three of whom are in school. Liberathe herself completed 8 years of primary school.

Liberathe grows potatoes. This is her first loan cycle with ACB. She will use her loan to buy 200kg of seed potatoes and 40kg of chemical fertilizer, and to pay workers.

In order to expand her farming business, she is planning to buy fields to increase the size of her farm, and will request more loans in the future. In the next few years, she would like to become a major distributor of potatoes in her area. She will use her profits to pay for her children's school fees and build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy 200kg of seed potatoes and 40kg of chemical fertilizer, and pay workers.

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en: Zawadi is a single mother of two children, both of whom attend school. She operates a retail food stand, selling to her neighbours and passersby. Once in a while she travels to Mombasa to bring back merchandise to fill the orders that she receives. Zawadi is requesting a loan to purchase bread products, meats, oils, vegetables and other ingredients to make the meals she serves at her stand.

loans.use: to purchase bread products, meats, oils and vegetables

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. Mohamad is 44 years old, married, and has four children.  He has owned a food market since 2006, selling soft drinks, juices, cheese, frozen beef, chicken, fish, dairy products, and other groceries. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and is well-known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $3,000 loan in order to pay the annual rent and to increase his inventory. He aims to gain more profit to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent and to increase his inventory.

loans.name: Bushra's Group

texts.en:
Bushra is a very talented lady, embroidering clothes to financially contribute to the family.  Her husband operates a photocopier machine and offers photocopy services to his clients.  Bushra is the mother of two sons. Both of them do different kinds of work to financially contribute to the family.  With the loan investment, she will buy an embroidery machine. 

Before, she was operating her business manually.  Although that earned her good profits, she is now expecting more orders, which she can fill with an embroidery machine.  She is very experienced and confident that she will make her business more profitable after this loan investment.

loans.use: to buy an embroidery machine for her embroidery business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy merchandise such as rice, sugar, noodles, milk, vegetable stews, etc.

loans.name: Pheakdey's Group

texts.en: Pheakdey is 28 years old and a widowed mother of two children, both of whom are too young to attend school. To support her family, Pheakdey plants rice once a year. Pheakdey obtained her first loan from VisionFund in 2011 and has successfully repaid the loan. This previous loan enabled her to afford the labor fee on land plowing and household expenses. Pheakdey is now leading a group of two members to apply for another loan and is hoping to get the money to buy fertilizer and pay the labor fee on land plowing. She very much hopes this loan will help to grow more crops and then sell the rice for a higher price so she can save for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay labor fees.

loans.name: Dolores Catalina

texts.es:
Dolores, administra una tienda, vive con su madre está soltera y desde hace 10 años está dedicada al negocio, lo atiende todos los días de la semana desde las siete de la mañana hasta las ocho de la noche.
Ella solicita un préstamo para realizar la compra de insumos de primera necesidad los cuales necesita invertir los en el negocio, se comprará aceite, arroz, azúcar, frijoles, detergentes y Jabón, que le ayudará a mejorar el inventario actual y poder prestar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
Su objetivo es a traves del préstamo tener un negocio más rentable, más surtido de productos ya que esto considera que le generará mejor aceptación con sus clientes.
texts.en:
Dolores runs a store and lives with her mother.  She is single and has been in business for ten years, working every day of the week from 7:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m.

She is requesting a loan to buy essential items for the business such as oil, rice, sugar, beans, detergents and soap.  This will increase her current stock so she can provide better customer service.

Her goal is for the loan to help her business become more profitable by having a wider variety of products on hand, as this will keep the customers happy.

loans.use: To buy oil, rice, sugar, beans, detergents and soap.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORICHUSPA”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Maria Cristina continua dedicandose al negocio de restaurante, la socia lleva años en este su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone a su negocio,a la vez la socia alquila su local para cualquier tipo de compromisos como matriminios,fiestas de 15 años entre otros,la socia es una persona alegre y responsable siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el prestamo para la compra de insumos para su restaurante como arroz y aceite.

La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "QORICHUSPA", which is located in the district of Huanchac in the province and department of Cusco.

The member is Maria Cristina who continues with her restaurant business, which she has been involved in for several years and made successful thanks to her hard work.  She also rents out her space for events such as weddings, debutante balls, etc.  She is a cheerful, responsible person who provides for her family through her business activities.

She is requesting a loan to buy supplies for her restaurant, such as rice and oil.

She is very grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her restaurant, such as rice and oil.

loans.name: Berhan

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 45 years old, single and lives with a family member.

Berhan is an owner of a small shop for repairing electronic devices. He opened his business in 2003 and therefore he now has good experience in this field. He has a good reputation and his shop is well known in the local area.

He is requesting $1800 in order to pay the annual rent for the shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to have better life conditions.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for the shop.

loans.name: Dovya Group

texts.en:
Devotha, who is in her early 30s, is married and has two children who go to school. She has been a food vendor for four months now. She works from 6 am to 5 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she wants to use for increasing her stock of food, so she can sell to more people. Her dream is to one day be able to own a hotel.

Devotha will share this loan with her loan group, "Dovya," which has a total of 16 members who will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to increase her stock of food so she can sell to more people.

loans.name: Sum

texts.en:
Sum, age 30, is a humble villager from Baray district in Kompong Tom province. She lives there with her husband and two school-age children. She owns one-and-a half hectares of farmland, on which she grows rice and a few kinds of vegetables to add to her husband’s income. Her husband shares his responsibilities for the family by transporting and selling firewood from a trailer, earning an average of $7 per day.

With the requested amount, Sum will purchase a cow for both farming and transporting firewood. In the coming years, Sum wants to upgrade the way she farms. She wants to buy a plowing machine, a water pump, and other farm machines that can be used to increase her productivity.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for both farming and transporting firewood.

loans.name: Consuelo Del Carmen

texts.es:
Consuelo, vive con su esposo y sus hijos, la casa es propia en la que reside, ella es ama de casa y al mismo tiempo apoya a su esposo en el cultivo de maíz y la crianza de ganado, tiene más de 20 años de estar destacados en esta actividad agropecuaria.
Ella solicita un préstamo, pues se dispone a realizar la siembra de maíz, para lo cual necesita el financiamiento para la compra de abonos, herbicidas y pesticidas, que son los materiales que se inicia aplicando al terreno para que pueda tener una buena cosecha libre de plagas.
Su objetivo es que a través de este préstamo puedan mejorar sus cultivos, del cual podría obtener unos grandes beneficios al comercializar la cosecha.
texts.en:
Consuelo lives with her husband and children in her own house.  She is a homemaker and also helps her husband grow corn and raise livestock.  For 20 years they have been in the farm business.

She is requesting a loan to begin planting corn for which she must buy fertilizers, weed killers and instecticides.  These are the supplies she needs for the land in order to have a good harvest free of plagues.

Her goal is to use the loan to improve their crop so they can obtain a good profit from selling their harvest.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, weed killers and insecticides.

loans.name: Beathe

texts.en: Beathe has six children aged between one and thirteen years. She sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for ten years. With the loan she wants to buy more beans, sorghum and maize to sell. The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more beans, sorghum and maize to sell.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de agricultura,ella siembra maiz y luego lo vende en las diferentes ferias,la socia tambien se deduca al negocio de restaurant,ella prepara desayunos,almuerzos y cenas,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelate a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar y mejorar los negocios de agricultura y restaurant.La socia solicita el credito para comprar productos para cocinar para su restaurant como arroz,carne,verduras y pollo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member is a farmer who grows and sells corn at different markets.  She also has a restaurant business and prepares breakfast, lunch and dinner.  She works from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. and has been able to provide for her children through her work.  Her goal is to expand and improve both her farm and restaurant businesses.  She is requesting a loan to buy products for the restaurant, such as rice, meat, vegetables and chicken.

The member is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy products for the restaurant, such as rice, meat, vegetables and chicken.

loans.name: Abbass

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a 30-year-old youth client, is married, and has five children. He lives with six family members, four of whom work.

Abbass has owned a food market since 2012, selling soft drinks, juices, groceries, cheese, frozen beef, chicken, fish, and dairy products. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows their needs. He has a good reputation and is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting $2,400 as a youth loan in order to paint his market’s wall and to increase his inventory. He is aiming to gain more profits to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to paint his market’s wall and to increase his inventory.

loans.name: Nom's Group

texts.en:
Nom is 58 years old and married with six children, three of whom are students and live with the family. Living in a rural area of Moung Russey district, Nom and her husband have farmed rice on 2.5 hectares of land for 10 years to support their family. 

Nom has been with KIVA's field partner, VisionFund, for one loan cycle and now is leading another group loan with two members to apply for a new loan after her first loan ended. As the leader, Nom will use her portion to spend on land preparation and also to buy fertilizers and gasoline for water pump. Through this loan, Nom hopes to improve both quality and quantity of her crops and therefore sell the products for a good price.

loans.use: prepare farmland and to buy fertilizers and gasoline for water pump.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a youth client, 27 years old, married and has one child.

Mohamad owns a small shop for spare car parts. He's owned his business since 2011. He now has good experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding area.

He is requesting a $3000 youth loan to pay the annual rent for the shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better life conditions.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for the shop.

loans.name: Shodiya

texts.en: Shodiya is as good with her family as she is in business. She works hard to complete perfectly all her business dealings by herself. For more than 15 years Shodiya has had her own business. She keeps livestock and also grows feed for livestock. Shodiya likes her work, and that’s why she works with pleasure from early morning till late evening. In this way, she earns money for feeding her family. Shodiya has a friendly family. Her husband helps her with her business. Shodiya has two children and loves them very much. She would like to get a loan to buy a cow to increase her business.

loans.use: To buy a cow and feed.

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s motor-workshop business. He is very good at his work and his clients come to his workshop for their conveyance maintenance. 

Shahnaz herself is a housewife, remains at home and does her household responsibilities. She is the mother of 4 sons and a daughter. Due to financial constraints she couldn’t educate her children. 

With the loan investment, he will buy the latest repair tools to offer even better quality services to his clients and increase his income. 

Shahnaz has full confidence in her husband that he will make good use of the money and successfully be able to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy the latest repair tools for motor workshop.

loans.name: Pc2 Mbourokh Mbour Group

texts.fr:
Ce banc villageois a été créé depuis le 24/04/2010. Il est composé de femmes qui habitent le même village et 

des villages environnants.L'activité principale de ses membres se trouve être le petit commerce.

Ils sont tous liées par de bonnes relations sociales.

Madame Amy est une femme mariée âgée de 40 et mère de 8 enfants dont 3 filles et 5 garçons.

Elle est debout à gauche de la photo.Elle fait du petit commerce de farine de mil depuis longtemps , son 

nouveau crédit de 95000 lui permettra de se procurer de la marchandise et revendre au niveau de son village.

Les bénéfices générés par son activité lui permettent de payer du riz de l'huile et du sucre pour sa famille.
texts.en:
This Banc Villageois was set up on 24th June 2010 and is made up of women who live in either the same village or surrounding villages. The main activity of the group members is small trading businesses. They are all have good social relations with each other.

Amy is a married woman who is 40 years old and mother to eight children: three girls and five boys. She is standing on the left of the photo. She has had a small millet flour trading activity for a long time and her new loan of 95,000 francs will enable her to buy goods to resell in her village. The profits she makes from her business allow her to pay for rice, oil and sugar for her family.

loans.use: to buy groundnut flour.

loans.name: Theogene

texts.en: Theogene is 37 years old. He is a father of three children. His wife helps in managing the business. He has requested a loan to buy more items such as rice, sugar, and salt for resale. With the profits from the business will be for reinvesting in the same business.

loans.use: To buy more rice, sugar, and salt for resale.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 52 years old and married and has four children. Merlinda works very hard to provide for them. 

Merlinda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 14,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store. 

Merlinda has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as biscuits, canned goods, detergent, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future Merlinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Elvin Marin

texts.es:
Elvin de 30 años de edad es originario de Estelí, casado, padre de un hijo que esta a su cargo, Elvin además de tener su titulo de ingeniero en sistema se dedica al  comercio, brinda el servicio de Cyber café en su comunidad desde hace un año, negocio donde ha obtenido experiencia y total dominio. Inicio su actividad debido a que el antiguo dueño del Cyber decidió vender el negocio a un precio  favorable, Elvin vio la oportunidad de independizarse y tener su propio negocio, busco apoyo de instituciones financieras  para poder comprar el Cyber con la esperanza de tener un negocio y poder salir adelante. Este ha sido su primer negocio donde recibe el apoyo de su esposa que le ayuda con la administración del Cyber. Cuenta con otros ingresos pues recibe remesas de familiares que están fuera del país, el esta satisfecho en el lugar donde se encuentra pues no tiene competencia en la zona además cuenta con clientes fijos. Solicita el crédito para comprar repuestos para sus computadoras como mouse, monitor, teclado, etc. 
Este crédito será de ayuda ya que podrá darle mantenimiento a sus maquinas para ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes, sus planes futuros es poner un segundo negocio que será una librería, comprar otras computadoras para un servicio mas rápido y remodelar el Cyber para una mejor presentación del negocio, su expectativa es llegar a tener su casa propia para evitar los gastos de estar alquilando y asi tener un negocio fijo que le genere mas ingresos para poder salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Elvin, 30 years old, is originally from Estelí.  He is married and the father to a son who is in his care.  

In addition to having his degree in systems engineering, he has owned an internet cafe in his community for a year, where he has gotten experience and knowledge.  He started this business when the old owner of the internet cafe decided to sell the business at a favorable price.  Elvin saw the opportunity to become independent and have his own business, so he found support from financial institutions to purchase the business with the hope of having a business and being able to get ahead.  This has been his first business that he has shared with his wife, who helps with the administration of the internet cafe.  He also has other income since he receives money from relatives who are outside of the country.  He is happy with the place he has found himself, since he has no competition in the area and has a fixed customer base.  

He is asking for this loan to purchase spare parts for the computers, such as mouses, monitors, keyboards, and more.  This loan will help because he can perform maintenance on his machines to offer better service to his customers.  His future plans are to open a second business, which will be a bookstore, to purchase other computers for faster service, and to remodel the internet cafe for a better presentation of the business.  He hopes to own his own home to avoid the costs of renting, and to have a stable business that generates more income so that he can get ahead with his family.

loans.use: to purchase computer accessories such as mouses, monitors, and keyboards.

loans.name: Oscar Ovidio

texts.es:
Oscar, se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol y a la crianza de ganado, vive con su esposa y tres hijos de 8,10, y 12 años de edad, está dedicado a la actividad agropecuaria desde hace 15 años, trabaja todos los días desde las seis de la mañana hasta las tres de la tarde.
El está solicitando un préstamo para poder realizar la compra de abono y herbicidas, que son los necesario para iniciar el cultivo de maíz y frijol, esto le ayudará a tener una siembra libre de plagas y poder ayudar de una mejor manera a su familia.
Su objetivo es desarrollarse como agricultor y crecer en la ganadería, ya que esto le ayudará también a su familia y a sus hijos para que sientan el apoyo económico y puedan superarse en sus estudios
texts.en:
Oscar, who works cultivating corn and beans and raising cattle, lives with his wife and their three children, who are 8, 10, and 12 years old.  He has done this agricultural activity for fifteen years.  He works every day from 6:00am until 3:00pm.

He is asking for this loan to purchase fertilizer and herbicides which are necessary to start growing corn and beans.  This will help him have a pest-free planting and increase his ability to help his family.

His goal is to develop himself as a farmer and grow in livestock since this will also help his family and his children so that they feel financially supported so they can excel at their studies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and herbicides.

loans.name: Cesar Fermelis

texts.es:
César, se dedica al cultivo de maíz y de frijol, vive con su familia y sus padres, él está soltero, inició la actividad agrícola hace 10 años, trabaja todos los días desde las seis de la mañana hasta las tres de la tarde, esto lo aprendido con su padre.

El está iniciando la siembra de la temporada de invierno para esto deberá invertir en abono, herbicidas, semilla de maíz y frijol, por eso está solicitando un préstamo que le ayude a cubrir ese gasto y a mantener todos los insumos necesarios para desarrollar el cultivo de una mejor manera y prevenirlo de las plagas.

Su primordial objetivo es tener un trabajo del que pueda apoyar a su familia, con este préstamo también quiere tener una producción abundante y sana.
texts.en:
César earns a living growing corn and beans. He lives with his family and his parents. He is single, and began farming ten years. He works every day from six a.m. until three p.m. and learned this with his father. 

He is starting his winter sowing and must invest in fertilizer, herbicides, and corn and beans for planting. Thus he is seeking a loan which would help him cover those costs and have on hand all the necessary supplies for better developing the crops and preventing infestations. 

His primary objective is to have work with which to support his family. With this loan he also wants to have an abundant and healthy crop.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, herbicides and corn and beans for planting.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 39 years old and married. She has five children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Helen has been farming sugarcane for 12 years.

Helen is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Jerlyn

texts.en:
Jerlyn is 43 years old and married. She has five children.

Jerlyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines. She has been running the coconut wine vending business for 10 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Jerlyn has requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional gallons of coconut wine to sell.

Jerlyn has borrowed and paid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Jerlyn aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional gallons of coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.en:
Zulfiya is a careful mother. She does all the best for her children. Zulfiya has two sons and two daughters. The sons help their mother in business. 

Their business is to keep livestock. Zulfiya cares for cattle for five or six months and then sells them to local people. 

Some years ago, they had a problem with their house. That’s why they bought a site and began to build a house with new and modern planning. Zulfiya wants to build the most comfortable house, and with this aim, she would like to get a loan for buying building materials.

loans.use: To buy building materials.

loans.name: Thy's Group

texts.en:
Thy and Voeurn are new to VisionFund. They live in a rural area of the Moung Russey district. They requested loans from VisionFund of 1,000,000 Khmer Riel each. 

Thy, the leader, is a mother of six. She has been farming rice for ten years. She also works at the house construction site for additional income. She  spent her portion on fertilizers for her rice crops and the remaining money was given to her children when they migrated to Thailand to make money as paid workers. 

Thy hopes that the loan will allow her to manage her business successfully by having good yield crops and hence making more income to support her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and help her children migrate to Thailand for work.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
Félix tiene 56 años de edad, vive en unión libre, tiene 3 hijos y vive en el Municipio de Santa Cruz de Yojoa.
Félix  tiene un negocio de venta de fruta y verduras. Este negocio lo inicio hace 2 años con el objetivo de trabajar lo propio y generar sus propios ingresos.  Su negocio esta establecido en un pequeño lugar  en el centro del mercado donde exhibe los productos para que los clientes lleguen a comprar, vende de toda clase de verdura y fruta  fresca como tomate, chile, repollo, cebolla, rábano, yuca, jilotes, papas, limones,naranja, bananos, etc.  Manifiesta que las ventas son a diario ya que son productos que las amas de casa necesitan en el hogar.
Don Félix es cliente de odef, con este préstamo que solicito de 5,000 lempiras lo necesita para comprar verduras ya que no tiene suficiente para la venta.  Como tomate, repollo, papas, yuca, Chile, banano, naranja, sandia, etc. Esta inversión piensa incrementar las ventas y la atención a los clientes.
Su meta es seguir creciendo en su negocio para tener más volumen en las ventas y poder  tener un local acondicionado y fijo para su negocio.
texts.en:
Féliz, age 56, is in a common-law marriage, and he has three children.  He lives in the Santa Cruz de Yojoa municipality.

Félix has a business selling fruit and vegetables. He started this business two years ago with the objective of working for himself and generating his own income.  His business is set up at a small spot in the center of the market.  This is where he displays his products so that the customers come to buy.  

He sells all types of fresh vegetables and fruit like tomatoes, chilies, cabbage, onions, radishes, manioc, corn, potatoes, limes, oranges, and bananas, etc.  He says that he makes his sales daily because they are products that the housewives need at home.

Félix is an ODEF client.  He will use the requested loan for 5,000 lempira to buy vegetables because he does not have enough to sell.  He will buy things like tomatoes, cabbage, potatoes, manioc, chilies, bananas, oranges, and watermelon, etc.  With this investment he plans on increasing his sales and customer service.

His goal is to continue growing in his business in order to have a greater volume of sales.  He wants to be able to have an established, fixed place for his business.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, cabbage, potatoes, manioc, chilies, bananas, oranges, and watermelon, etc

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
Manuel, se dedica al cultivo de maíz y de frijol, está soltero, vive con sus padres, está dedicado a la actividad agrícola desde hace 10 años, trabajando desde las seis de la mañana hasta las tres de la tarde, esta actividad la aprehendió a través de su padre.
El está solicitando un préstamo, para poderse comprar los materiales agrícolas necesarios para aplicarlo al cultivo de maíz y frijol, como el abono, y herbicidas, que le ayuda a fortalecer la siembra y a prevenir la de las plagas este préstamo será una gran ayuda para proporcionarle lo necesario y poder seguir trabajando.
El objetivo de Manuel es encontrar la alternativa para poder desarrollar un mejor cultivo del cual pueda tener abundantes cosechas.
texts.en:
Manuel earns a living growing corn and beans. He is single and lives with his parents. He has been farming for 10 years, working from six a.m. until three p.m., and learned this business through his father. 

He is seeking a loan in order to be able to purchase the necessary farming supplies for applying to the production of corn and beans, such as fertilizer and herbicides, which help him strengthen the harvest and prevent infestations. This loan will be a great help in providing what is necessary so he can keep working. 

Manuel's objective is to find the alternative in order to be able to develop a better crop from which he may have abundant harvests.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and herbicides.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a salted sea foods business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy more stocks of fish, shrimp and packaging products for her salted sea foods business.

NWTF is relisting Remedios's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making her fermented fish.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a small fishpond business in the Philippines. Joan has been in this business for five years. She earns additional income from rice retailing and selling ready-to-wear clothes.

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase additional feed for her fishpond business.

Joan has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional feed.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa is 38 years old and married. She has two children.

Josefa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a direct selling business of Avon products in the Philippines. She has been running the direct selling business for five years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice and from her general store. 

She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Josefa has borrowed and paid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Josefa aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 41 years old and married. She has two children.

Grace works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store business in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns an income from raising livestock. 

Grace requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Grace has borrowed and repaid 28 loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Grace aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
Doña Martina de 57 años de edad, vive en una colonia suburbana de la ciudad de Gracias Lempira junto a su esposo.
Ella tiene 5 años de atender el cultivo de café, anteriormente se dedicaba a cultivar hortalizas y granos básicos. La producción la vende en la zona del municipio de Gracias Lempira. Es el séptimo préstamo que solicita a ODEF y lo necesita para comprar fertilizantes y para pago de mano de obra en mantenimiento de la finca de café. Este préstamo le ayudara a mejorar la finca y sacar buenas cosechas lo que le permitirá obtener buenos ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Doña Martina is 57 years old and lives in a suburban section of the city of Gracias Lempira alongside her husband. She has been growing coffee for five years. Martina previously cultivated vegetables and basic grains. Whatever she produces is sold at the district market in Gracias Lempira.

This is the seventh loan she has requested from ODEF. Martina needs to buy fertilizers and pay for labor in order to maintain her coffee farm. This loan will help to improve her farm and achieve better yields. As a result, she will generate a good income for improving her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Uldarico

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “QORICHUSPA”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia y departamento de Cusco.

El socio Uldarico continua dedicandose a la confeccion de disfraces, buzos,camisas entre otros,el socio lleva buen tiempo en este su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone a su negocio,el socio cuenta con un pequeño taller que se encuentra ubicado en su casa,el socio a la vez continua trabajando en una empresa privada, el socio es una persona responsable siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.

El socio solicita el credito para la compra de telas.

El socio se siente agradecido por el prestamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “Qorichuspa" located in the district of Huanchac in the province and department of Cusco. 

The member Uldarico continues devoting himself to the making of costumes, track suits and shirts among other items. He has been working a good long time in this business which is going well thanks to the effort he gives it. The member has a small workshop which is located in his home. The member also continues to work in a private company. The member is a responsible person and in this way he gets his family ahead. 

The member is seeking the loan for the purchase of fabrics. 

The member is appreciative of the loan he is being given and commits to making the established payments.

loans.use: to purchase fabric for making costumes and track suits.

loans.name: Sergio Antonio

texts.es:
Sergio Antonio tiene 34 años de edad, vive en una aldea del municipio de Morazan, Yoro, junto a su esposa sus dos hijos de 4 y 7 años de edad.
Sergio a realizado trabajos de agricultura como jornalero, y hace 4 años su suegro le apoyo para que hiciera sus propios cultivos, ahora tiene dos manzanas de cultivo de maiz.la producción la vende en el mercado local de la comunidad. El solicita un préstamo de 5,000.oo Lempiras para comprar sacos de abono para el cultivo de maíz, y así lograr sacar buenas cosechas.  Su plan continuar trabajando y haciendo cada vez más parcelas de maíz para aumentar la producción y los ingresos familiares. 
El pertenece al Grupo solidario llamado Naranjo, que está formado por 3 integrantes, que viven en la misma comunidad y se dedican a la agricultura.
texts.en:
Sergio Antionio, age 34, lives in a village in the Morazan municipality in Yoro.  He lives with his wife and their two children, ages 4 and 7.

Sergio does agricultural work as a day worker.  Four years ago his father-in-law supported him getting his own crops.  He now has two “manzanas” [a manzana is 7000 square meters] of corn.  He sells the production at the local community market.

He is requesting a loan for 5,000 lempiras in order to buy sacks of fertilizer for his corn crop.  This way he will manage to get good harvests.  His plan is to continue working and to keep expanding his corn crops in order to increase production and the family income.

He belongs to the Naranjo communal bank.  The communal bank is comprised of three members who live in the same community and devote themselves to agriculture.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his corn crop.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong is a 44-year-old married woman who has been residing in the Baray district of Kompong Tom province. She is married and her husband works in the same business as she does: cultivating rice and other crops on their inherited farm land. Hong owns a huge farm land of around five or six hectares, so each harvesting season she can collect a high production and make a good income to satisfy the family.

Now it’s a time for Hong to start growing her rice and potato crops again. Therefore, she has applied for a loan of USD 1,500 to purchase seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and to pay for the whole process of cultivating her crops. For the future, she believes that she can provide a good education to all of her children.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and to pay for the whole process of cultivating her crops.

loans.name: Khotamsho

texts.en:
Four years ago, Khotamsho leased 2.8 hectares of land and began to work hard. He grows vegetables and has many customers because the vegetables  have high quality and cheap prices. Local people are glad to deal with Khotamsho. 

Khotamsho is married and has six children. He tries to do the best for his children. His wife and his brother help him in his business. 

For developing his business, Khotamsho is asking for a loan. He wants to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers for the land where he works.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Pc2 Onze Novembre Mbour Group

texts.fr:
Ce banc villageois a été  crée depuis le 20/04/2010. Il regroupe des femmes issus du même quartier et des 

quartiers environnants.

Les membres de ce groupes sont unis par des liens sociaux , elle s'activent toutes dans le petit commerce.

Madame Fatou est une femme mariée âgée de 40 ans et mère de  9 enfants dont 5 filles et 4 garçons.

Elle est debout  en extrême droite de la photo couvert d'un écharpe blanc .

Elle fait du commerce par la vente de jus a base de pain de singe et de bissap.

Son nouveau prêt de 50000 elle va acheter de la marchandise pré citée et préparer des jus qu'elle va revendre 

au détails au niveau de son quartier.

Les bénéfices tirés de son activité lui permettent de payer la scolarité de des de ses enfants et de payer 

également des habits pour les autres a l'occasion des fêtes religieuses.
texts.en:
This Banc Villageois was set up on 24th April 2010 and is made up of women who live in either the same district or surrounding districts. The group members were brought together through social relationships and they all have small trading businesses. 

Fatou is a married woman who is 40 years old and mother to nine children: five girls and four boys. She is standing on the far right of the photo. She sells juice made out of monkey bread and bissap (a refreshing drink made out of hibiscus flowers). With her new loan of 50,000 francs she is going to buy the aforementioned goods which she will resell on a retail basis in her district. The profits she makes from her business allow her to pay for her children's schooling as well as clothing for others for religious festivals.

loans.use: to buy sugar, monkey bread and bissap (a refreshing drink made from hibiscus flowers).

loans.name: Claudia Jesus

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de articulos como para epocas navideñas y tambien año nuevo,pero la socia tambien se sigue dedicando al negocio de agricultura,la socia siembra maiz y luego lo vende al por mayor,por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante  a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocios sus terrenos donde cultivan maiz.La socia solicita el credito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes para sus terrenos de cultivo.
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The group-member Claudia continues working in the sale of various items such as seasonal items for Christmas and New Year’s Eve. She also continues her agricultural business. She sows maiz and then sells it wholesale. By way of these businesses she is helping her children move to a better future. Her dream is to expand the businesses, her land where she grows corn. She is asking for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for her crop-land. 

Claudia is happy for the loan and promises to make the repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers wholesale.

loans.name: Kasimzhon

texts.en: Many children know Kasimzhon as the “milky uncle”. Kasimzhon loves children very much and always tries to do something for their joy. For more than 12 years, he has been busy keeping cattle. He sells milk and meat to local citizens. In business too, Kasimzhon helps his wife. She is very happy that he is a kind and loving husband. Kasimzhon’s wife is a good cook and she prepares tasty foods for her husband from their own milk and meat products. Kasimzhon wants to improve their standard of living and, with this aim, he is asking for a loan from IMON. He wants to buy livestock and feed in order to develop his business.

loans.use: to buy livestock and feed.

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.en:
Rodrigo is 52 years old, married, and has 7 children, 4 of whom are in school.

Rodrigo is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. He has requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Rodrigo has been farming vegetables for 8 years now, and he has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain his business.

In the future, Rodrigo would like to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Elma Dolores

texts.es: La Sra. Elma tiene 45 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo mayor de edad, ella vive en una colonia al sur de la ciudad de Olanchito. y tiene su propio negocio desde hace 5 años, prestando los servicios secretariales a estudiantes y al público en general, ella vende fotocopias de documentos, impresiones, y otros, además vende útiles escolares como cuadernos, plumas, memorias, etc. su negocio está ubicado en la zona comercial de la ciudad. Ha mantenido varios prestamos con ODEF actualmente solicita 21,000.00 Lempiras con el cual va surtir el negocio comprando útiles escolares como cuadernos, plumas, papel, folders y otros. Su plan es llegar a tener su propio local y que su negocio crezca mas.
texts.en:
Sra. Elma is 45 years old and a single mother with a grown son. She lives in a neighborhood that is south of the city of Olanchito. Elma has managed her own business for five years, providing secretarial services to students and the general public. She provides document photocopying, printing, and other services. Elma also sells school supplies such as notebooks, pens, flash drives, and other items. Her business is located in a commercial area of the city.

Elma has received several loans from ODEF and is currently requesting 21,000 HNL. She will restock her business by purchasing school supplies such as notebooks, paper, folders, and other items. Her plan is to have her own location and grow her business even more.

loans.use: to buy school supplies and materials for providing secretarial services.

loans.name: Uzma's Group

texts.en:
Uzma is the mother of 4 children. Two of them study while the other two are still too young to attend school. She is very skilful and works as a beautician. She is an expert in bridal makeup and earns reasonably good profits every month.  

Uzma's husband has a business selling scrap. He takes orders from different factories and other scrap dealers and fulfills their orders on time. Uzma has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan investment, he will buy scrap in bulk quantities, which will help him to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy scrap for her husband's scrap business

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
Leonisa is 48 years old and married with 2 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the store for 5 years and also earns income from farming sugarcane and raising livestock.

Leonisa has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell. She has borrowed and repaid 3 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. 

Leonisa aspires to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional stocks of merchandise to sell

loans.name: Ek's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of Battambang Province, where rice farming is a common business, Ek and her husband have been farming rice to support their family for ten years. They also raise pigs, which they sell sell to earn additional income. Ek has six children, all of whom live with the family and some of whom are students.

This is Ek's second loan with VisionFund. Ek's group consists of four members, all of whom are female. Ek, as a leader, has requested the loan and will use her portion to purchase fertilizers for her rice plantations and gasoline for her water pump. She hopes through this loan her crop yield will be increased so that she can sell her harvest for a higher price and she can improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her rice crops and gasoline for her water pump

loans.name: Jerusha

texts.en:
Jerusha makes all kinds of shoes, and she has added a printing business to earn more profits. Thanks to the previous loan from Kiva, she has improved her work and expanded her business a bit more.

Jerusha is now requesting a loan to buy raw materials, including leather and shoe soles, because she has many orders and wants to fill them. Her goal is to have a larger business so she can offer a variety of shoes and continue expanding. She is grateful for this new opportunity, which will be very helpful to her.

loans.use: to buy raw materials, including leather and shoe soles

loans.name: Dolores Margarita

texts.es:
Dolores Margarita tiene 41 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene  2 hijos y vive con una de ellos en una aldea del Municipio de Nueva Frontera, Santa Barbará.
Doña Dolores lleva 10 años dedicándose a la actividad de venta de mercadería. Este negocio lo inicio con el objetivo de generar sus propios ingresos ya que no cuenta con la ayuda económica del padre de sus hijos. Doña Dolores vende su mercadería de manera ambulante visitando varias comunidades de los alrededores donde ya ha hecho sus propios clientes. Ofreciendo venta de ropa como pantalones, blusas, camisas, también adicional vende productos comestibles como cacahuates en cantidad y las ristras de consomé, ella surte los pequeños negocios de las diferentes comunidades. 
Ella solicito un préstamo de 12,000 lempiras para invertir en la compra de ropa y cacahuate, con esta inversión piensa aumentar su capital de trabajo obteniendo mejores ganancias. Y tener el producto necesario para la venta y ofrecer el servicio surtiendo las pulperías. 
Espera en el futuro llegar a obtener el capital necesario para poder comprar un vehículo que le facilite poder movilizarse para  seguir vendiendo sus productos.
texts.en:
Dolores Margarita is 41 years old and a single mother with two children. She lives in one of the neighborhoods in the town of Nueva Frontera, Santa Barbará.

Doña Dolores has been selling merchandise for 10 years. She started her business in order to generate her own income since she was not receiving financial support from the father of her children. Doña Dolores sells merchandise as a street vendor by visiting various communities in the surrounding areas where she has established customers. She sells clothes such as trousers, blouses, and shirts, but she also sells food products in bulk, such as peanuts and instant soup packets. Dolores restocks her business by going to different communities.

She is requesting a loan of 12,000 HNL so that she can invest in the purchase of clothing and peanuts. This investment will increase her operating capital and help her generate better earnings. She will also have the necessary products to sell and to offer to the grocery stores. Dolores hopes in the future to obtain enough capital to buy a vehicle, which will enable her to travel around more easily as she continues to sell her products.

loans.use: to buy clothing and peanuts.

loans.name: Nelita

texts.en:
Nelita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years.

Nelita has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like pants, caps, belts, and other ready-to-wear items to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items like pants, caps, belts, and other ready-to-wear items to sell.

loans.name: Kudratullo

texts.en:
Kudratullo is a person who likes to help to another people. During the past three years he has been busy driving for his taxi service. He has a lot of customers and all of them are grateful for Kudratullo’s deals. 

Kudratullo is married and has 4 children.  He wants to provide them a comfortable living with all of the modern conveniences. His wife doesn’t work so Kudratullo is the sole provider for the family. He is requesting a loan to buy spare parts for his car.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his car

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Lina has been in this business for 15 years. Lina earns additional income from buying and selling fruits.

Lina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food vending business

loans.name: Moslem

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 37 years old, married, and has three children.

Moslem is a tailor who makes curtains. He has owned his sewing shop since 2003, and therefore he has sufficient experience in this field and a deep understanding of local customers and their needs. He also repairs sewing machines. He has a good reputation, and he is well-known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting $3000 loan in order to pay the annual rent for his shop and to increase his inventory. He is aiming to increase his profits, which will offer a better standard of living for the whole family.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his shop and to increase his inventory

loans.name: Meali

texts.en:
Meali sells households consumption goods at her general store and thanks to this work she has been able to get ahead and help her family. Thanks to the loan she got from Kiva, she’s been able to grow and invest in her businesses and invest in real estate houses. 

She is calling on Kiva and Yehu Microfinance once more to install piped water in her real estate houses, purchase water pipes and water tank and she wants to be able to have more tenants and increase rent rates to increase her income.

Meali is grateful for the opportunity she’s receiving once again.

loans.use: to purchase water pipes and a water tank.

loans.name: Farkhanda's Group

texts.en:
Farkhanda has requested a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her sewing business. She will invest the loan to purchase a new sewing machine and threads so that she will be able to perform her work in a more efficient way and earn better income. 
She is the mother of two children, one son and one daughter. Her son is three while her daughter reads at a 8th grade level.  
Her husband works in a hotel earning a monthly wage. Because her husband’s income is insufficient in meeting the family's financial expenses, Farkhanda operates her business so that they both can handle their expanses and improve the living standards of their family.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine and threads for sewing business

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
This is Marilou. She previously availed a PHP 10,000 loan to purchase a greater quantity and variety of toy products for her business. Her earnings were a big help in her children's education and to meet their personal, household and business expenses. 

She would like to apply for another PHP 10,000 loan to buy additional stocks of toys and other products. The more items displayed in the store the better as that may lead to more sales and hence better profits. The profits will help her sustain her daily needs and her children's educational expenses.

Marilou dreams of growing her business as well as invest in her own house. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of toy products needed in her business.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 67 years old and married with six children.

Lolita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell.

Lolita had borrowed and paid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 8 years and also earns an income from dressing chicken.

Lolita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks to sell.

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
This is Kong, 51, a resident of Baray, Kompong Tom Province. She is married and has been blessed with six children: four are single and two are married. She and her husband help each other manage their household and businesses. She cultivates rice twice a year and raises a few piglets for slaughter. Recently, she has been working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses, including food and allowances for her children.

To help her continue the operation of her business, Kong is requesting a loan of KHR 2,000,000 to purchase additional piglets and feed for fattening them. She will also use part of the loan to buy a water pump that she will use to irrigate her rice field. She expects to increase her business income as she expands her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets and feed for fattening them as well as a water pump for her rice field.

loans.name: Ana Fabiana

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer de 47 años, vive en la ciudad de Nazca con sus 3 hijos, lastimosamente por diversas circunstancias desde hace varios años se separó de su pareja, desde entonces ella se ha hecho cargo de sus hijos, por quienes dedica todos sus esfuerzos para sacarlos adelante; Ana siempre ha sido una mujer muy luchadora, que ha trabajado desde muy joven, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar para solventar sus gastos Ana no pudo terminar de cursas sus estudios primarios, pero sueño con poder hacerlo algún día; en sus ratos libres le gusta cantar y en algunas ocasiones cocina unos riquísimos “Pallares con Seco” el cual es el plato favorito de su familia.
Por iniciativa propia y gracias a su deseo de superación, Ana puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de venta de productos naturistas y abarrotes, ella dedica a su negocio un aproximado de 12 horas diarias, ella cree que su negocio marcha bien debido ya que sus clientes la recomiendan por sus productos que alivian ciertas dolencias, asi como por su buena atención.
Ana se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mercadería para su negocio, tales como: pomadas, uña de gato, incienso, alcanfor y abarrotes como: leche, azúcar, arroz, gaseosas, golosinas, etc.; de esta manera tendrá un negocio mejor abastecido y así podrá incrementar sus ventas e ingresos económicos para con ellos poco a poco ahorrar el dinero necesario para iniciar la construcción de su vivienda de material noble y así asegurar el bienestar y futuro de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ana is a 47 year-old woman who lives in the city of Nazca with her 3 children.  Unfortunately, due to a variety of circumstances, she separated from her partner a number of years ago.  Since then, she has taken care of their children, and she dedicates all of her efforts to get them ahead.  Ana has always been a very tenacious woman who has worked ever since she was very young.  Sadly, due to a lack of financial resources and the need to work to pay her expenses, Ana was not able to finish her elementary school education, but she dreams of doing this someday.  In her spare time, she enjoys singing, and at times she cooks the rich "Pallares con Seco" (lamb stew with lima beans), which is her family's favorite dish.

On her own initiative, and thanks to her desire to succeed, Ana started up her own business selling natural products and groceries.  She works in her business about 12 hours a day, and she believes that it is doing well because her customers recommend the business for her products that relieve certain ailments, and for her good service.  

Ana is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, because thanks to the help they are providing she will be able to purchase merchandise for her business, such as: ointments, the "Cat's Claw" medicinal herb, incense, and camphor.  She will also buy groceries such as: milk, sugar, rice, soft drinks, candy, etc. 

In this way she will be able to have a well-stocked business, allowing her to increase her sales and her income so that she can gradually save the money she needs to start building a home made of solid materials that will ensure the well-being and future of her children.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, including groceries and natural products

loans.name: Nga's Group

texts.en: Nga and her husband supports the family by farming rice. They have been in this business for twelve years. Nga is 54 years old and has four children, two of whom are dependent on the family. The main constraint for Nga is having insufficient capital for the business. Nga has been with VisionFund for four loan cycles and all are completely repaid. Nga is now leading a group of three members to apply for loans from VisionFund. She will use her portion to spend on plowing land and also to buy fertilizers and seedlings for her plantation. Nga really hopes this loan will allow her to make more income so that she can buy more farmland for the family.

loans.use: To spend on plowing land and to buy fertilizers and seedlings.

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en: Annaliza is married with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Annaliza is 40 years old, and both of her children are in school. Annaliza has a local eatery (carinderia) business in the Philippines. Annaliza requested a 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan amount through NWTF to buy additional utensils for her local eatery business. Annaliza has been in this business for five years. In the future, Annaliza would like to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional utensils for her local eatery business.

loans.name: Dalia

texts.es:
Dalia tiene 21 años, es una mujer buena y trabajadora. Está separada de quien fue su pareja  y padre de su hijo de un año y 3 meses de nacido, quien es la razón de su esfuerzo, ya que quiere brindarle una vida confortable y más adelante una buena educación. Vive en casa de su madre y juntas realizan grandes esfuerzos para progresar.

Su trabajo es la venta de ropa, utensilios del hogar y gasolina, los cuales pone a la venta de manera quincenal o mensual. Cuenta con la ayuda de su madre que se encarga de comprar ropa usada, ollas, tazones, bandejas, escobas, combustible y otros artículos que luego vende por las zonas alejadas a la ciudad, principalmente en las comunidades ribereñas o centros poblados que carecen de estos artículos o no tienen acceso a la ciudad por la distancia y el gasto que esto le genera a sus pobladores. Ella se traslada en viajes por vía fluvial y su recorrido puede durar hasta 8 horas para llegar a su primer destino. Traslada gran cantidad de mercadería variada por lo que sus ingresos, al retornar, siempre son altos y sus ganancias, muchas veces, pueden triplicar su inversión inicial. Lleva en esta actividad cerca de 2 años, y eventualmente cuando se encuentra en la ciudad trabaja vendiendo productos de perfumería por catálogo. 
Le gusta mucho lo que hace, pues puede disponer de su propio dinero y aportar a la economía de su hogar, también le permite manejar su tiempo y dedicárselo al cuidado de su hijo, quien a su edad necesita todos la atención necesaria.

Este es su crédito número 3 con MFP, por tanto agradece la oportunidad y confianza que ponen en ella. Por otro lado, se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual. Y le agrada ser parte del banco comunal al que pertenece, ya que ha visto que sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias.

Con el monto solicitado (S/. 2000) comprará más artículos para poder vender en este mes que es cuando más aumenta la demanda por ser temporada de fiestas regionales.
texts.en:
Dalia, 21, is a hard-working and good woman.  She is separated from her husband and has a 15-month old son.  He is why she works hard-to offer him a comfortable life and a good education.  She lives in her mother’s house and she and her mother work together to get ahead.
She sells clothing, household items and gas twice a month or monthly.   Her mother helps her by buying the used clothing, pots, bowls, trays, mops, fuel and other articles that she then sells in areas far away from her home city.  She sells mostly in villages or in remote areas where the people can’t get to the city because of the distance and the cost. She travels by river and her trips can last up to 8 hours before she arrives at her destination.  She carries a lot of varied merchandise that give her a good income.  Sometimes she triples her initial investment.  Dalia has been in this business for about 2 years and when she is home in the city, she sells perfumes through a catalog.
She likes what she does because she can make her own money and carry the household expenses.  It also allows her to manage her own time and to be able to care for her son, who is at that age where he needs a lot of attention.
This is her 3rd loan with MFP and she appreciates the opportunity and confidence given her.  For her part she promises to make the payments on time and she is grateful to be a part of the communal bank since its members are responsible and supportive.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for this month of regional celebrations

loans.name: Pc 1 Kielle Group

texts.fr:
Ce banc villageois a été crée depuis son inauguration .

Il est composé de femmes qui habitent le même  village et se partagent des valeurs sociales communes.
 
Les membres qui le fondent s'activent toutes dans le commerce.

Madame Alassane est une femme  mariée âgée de 37 ans et mère de 7 enfants dont 6 filles et 1 garçon.

Alassane est debout à l'extrême droite de la photo et habillé en robe et foulard multicolore.

Elle s'active dans le commerce par la vente de légumes et de produits détergents.

Alassane fait cette activité depuis son adhésion au Banc Villageois. Son nouveau crédit de 200 000 elle va se 

payer de la marchandise pré citée.

Les bénéfices générés par son activité lui permettent de renforcer ses épargnes au niveau du banc villageois 

et de participer activement aux dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille.
texts.en:
This group was created when the banc villageois was inaugurated. Its members are all women who live in the same village, and who share the same social values. All of the group’s members work selling goods. 


Alassane is a 37-year-old married woman, who is mother to seven children – six girls and one boy. She is pictured standing to the extreme right in the photo, wearing a multicolored dress and headscarf. She works selling vegetables and detergent products, and has done so since she joined the banc villageois. 


The new loan of 200,000 francs CFA that Alassane has requested will be used to pay for pre-ordered merchandise. The profits generated from her business will be used to increase her savings with the banc villageois, and to actively participate in covering her family’s day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and detergent soaps.

loans.name: Tumenulzii

texts.en: Tumenulzii is 31 years old and lives with his mother in a ger (mongolian yurt) in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. His mother is employed and he has a road repairing business in the city. He started his own sidewalk repairing business in 2011 after working for 11 years in the field which has helped him gain rich experience as well as many customers. His business is going on well and demand for his work is increasing. However, he does all his work by hand and so his output is very slow.
